INEOS Britannia, the boat for the America‚Äôs Cup, stands majestically. Eliud Kipchoge, sporting a white INEOS shirt, smiles as he becomes the first person to run a marathon in less than two hours, and Mercede
fullText:
Underneath the black stairs at OGC Nice Football Club‚Äôs training ground, a colourful photo wall illustrates INEOS‚Äô sporting ventures.

The men‚Äôs teams of Manchester United, Ligue 1 side Nice and Swiss outfit Lausanne-Sport are pictured celebrating, and an INEOS Grenadiers cyclist speeds past. INEOS Britannia, the boat for the America‚Äôs Cup, stands majestically. Eliud Kipchoge, sporting a white INEOS shirt, smiles as he becomes the first person to run a marathon in less than two hours, and Mercedes-AMG Petronas Formula One drivers George Russell and Kimi Antonelli walk side by side. Seven-time F1 world champion Lewis Hamilton, then also with Mercedes, perches atop an INEOS Grenadiers vehicle alongside Sir Jim Ratcliffe.

Between Ratcliffe and INEOS ‚Äî the petrochemicals company he founded, co-owns and chairs ‚Äî more than ¬£2.5billion ($3.3bn) has been invested in the past eight years across sports including football, cycling, sailing and running, according to publicly available information.

Yet the interest in women‚Äôs sports seems practically non-existent.

In cycling, INEOS took control of Team Sky in April 2019 ‚Äî now competing as INEOS Grenadiers ‚Äî and was urged to start a women‚Äôs team by many, including the former head of the UCI, cycling‚Äôs world governing body, Brian Cookson. It never happened.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a surefire miss,‚Äù one former professional cyclist tells The Athletic. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm baffled as to why Ratcliffe hasn‚Äôt done it.‚Äù

In F1, INEOS is a partner and one-third owner of Mercedes-AMG Petronas, which has a French driver, 21-year-old Doriane Pin, in the sport‚Äôs all-women F1 Academy series.

Ratcliffe has also backed women in leadership positions across the business side of INEOS.

Lynn Calder is chief executive of INEOS automotive, makers of the Grenadier 4√ó4, and Florence Bardot and Natalina Arena hold senior finance roles in the petrochemicals field. Fran Millar was made CEO of Team Sky, INEOS Grenadiers and INEOS‚Äô former fashion business Belstaff, since bought by sportswear group Castore in August but in which INEOS retains an interest through a strategic investment agreed as part of that sale. Her successor was Kerry Byrne. But there are currently no female CEOs across INEOS‚Äô sports interests.

In sailing, Ratcliffe‚Äôs daughters, Julia Ratcliffe and Romane Polli, were named godmothers of INEOS‚Äô boat, Britannia, competing at the America‚Äôs Cup off Barcelona, Spain, last year and christened the boat by spraying Nyetimber English sparkling wine on the bow for good luck. INEOS, however, was not the title sponsor for last year‚Äôs women‚Äôs America‚Äôs Cup, the first of its kind.

After INEOS bought a minority stake in Manchester United in 2024, Ratcliffe has always been forthright about where the women‚Äôs team lie among his priorities. ‚ÄúThe men‚Äôs team make ¬£800million, the women‚Äôs team cost ¬£10m,‚Äù he told The Sunday Times in August 2024.

Ratcliffe has repeatedly said his focus has been on United‚Äôs men‚Äôs team because that is ‚Äúwhat moves the needle‚Äù, as he told BBC Sport in March. ‚ÄúOf our ¬£650million of income, ¬£640m of that comes from the men‚Äôs team and ¬£10m comes from the women‚Äôs team,‚Äù he added.

United‚Äôs 2023-24 accounts show the club lost ¬£130.7million ($174m at current rates) and the women‚Äôs team contributed ¬£100,000 to that loss, around 0.08 per cent.

Revenues in women‚Äôs elite sports, according to finance experts Deloitte, are predicted to have risen by 240 per cent from 2022 to 2025. The same firm forecasts global revenues to reach at least $2.35billion (¬£1.75bn) in 2025. The two highest revenue-generating sports are basketball and football/soccer, and, while this predicted growth does not extend to all disciplines, Deloitte has stated ‚Äúthe growth of women‚Äôs sport has continued to exceed expectations‚Äù.

So is INEOS‚Äô apparent lack of interest in women‚Äôs sport purely commercially driven? On the INEOS ‚Äòcompass‚Äô, which the company states was devised by Ratcliffe ‚Äúas a fun way of attempting to capture how INEOS works‚Äù, ‚Äúkids and sport‚Äù, ‚Äúfitness and health‚Äù and ‚Äúdo the right thing‚Äù are all in the ‚Äúthings we like‚Äù section.

And when it launched its support for Kipchoge‚Äôs sub-two-hour marathon attempt in May 2019, Ratcliffe said: ‚ÄúWe make six or seven billion dollars a year in profit, so what‚Äôs wrong with investing a bit of that in sport? On some good challenges, good people, try to inspire people? It‚Äôs good fun.‚Äù

Kipchoge, a member of the NN running team, which had a performance partnership with INEOS until it ended last week, was the athlete in the world most likely to stand any chance of running the marathon‚Äôs 26.2 miles in less than two hours. It is understandable INEOS backed a man in its pursuit of smashing such a significant human barrier.

However, when three-time Olympic and five-time world champion Faith Kipyegon, who has the same coach as Kipchoge and is also a NN athlete, attempted in June this year to be the first woman to run a mile in under four minutes ‚Äî a Nike-backed project called Breaking4 ‚Äî INEOS was not publicly involved. Kipyegon missed the mark by 6.42 seconds.

As INEOS closes in on the two-year anniversary of its investment in United, The Athletic has spoken to people familiar with its sporting endeavours, many of whom will remain anonymous to protect relationships, about the firm‚Äôs approach to women‚Äôs sport and women athletes.

‚ÄúINEOS missed the boat,‚Äù is a phrase repeated by many.

An INEOS spokesperson said: ‚ÄúWe are totally committed to supporting our female teams and athletes across all of our sports activities. This is most apparent in football, but also in our support for female cyclists and runners.‚Äù

Team Sky‚Äôs Bradley Wiggins, Chris Froome and Geraint Thomas dominated the Tour de France during the mid-2010s.

When INEOS took over Team Sky in 2019, it inherited an imperious operation led by Sir Dave Brailsford, who left British Cycling in 2014 after overseeing unprecedented success for men and women at World Championship and Olympic level. It also inherited a team facing questions about whether it had crossed the line in its dominance on the road.

In 2017, an independent review of British Cycling‚Äôs culture from 2012-16 was published, reporting that the ‚Äúenvironment was one which some female riders‚Ä¶ found uncomfortable‚Äù and there were ‚Äúfailings in British Cycling‚Äôs governance and leadership‚Äù. In February of that year, ahead of the review, Brailsford wrote in The Times that the team was ‚Äúmedallist, not sexist‚Äù.

Millar told magazine Rouleur in 2021 that, after the 2012 Olympics in London, she and rider Lizzie Deignan (then Armitstead) raised the prospect of starting a women‚Äôs team ‚Äúat every board meeting‚Äù for Team Sky. Some argued a women‚Äôs team was not warranted, given the struggling financial landscape of women‚Äôs cycling but by the late 2010s and early 2020s, several major men‚Äôs teams such as Visma-Lease a Bike, Lidl-Trek and Movistar, which still exist today, had launched women‚Äôs teams. Paris-Roubaix started a women‚Äôs race in 2021, won by Deignan riding for Trek-Segafredo, and the Tour de France Femmes was revived in 2022.

However, INEOS, Red Bull-Bora-Hansgrohe, Team Bahrain Victorious, Decathlon‚ÄìAG2R La Mondiale and XDS-Astana still have only men‚Äôs outfits.

In 2018, Natascha Knaven-den Ouden and her husband Servais Knaven, Team Sky‚Äôs sports director, set up APB, an under-19 women‚Äôs development team with six riders. Along with a French junior men‚Äôs team, APB‚Äôs women cycled with Team Sky‚Äôs pro riders on part of the cobbled Paris-Roubaix course ahead of the main event ‚Äî for men only ‚Äî in 2018.

In a Team Sky video from the time, Brailsford says: ‚ÄúWhen you‚Äôre a team like Team Sky at the highest level, what can you do for younger riders in the sport? Try to inspire. It‚Äôs something they and we‚Äôll remember, something for the sport; just enjoyable. Without the fundamentals, the clubs, the youngsters in the sport, we have nothing.‚Äù

At the 2018 Belgian Omloop Het Nieuwsblad, Knaven-den Ouden recalls Team Sky allowing APB riders to see first-hand how a team operates from the inside. They stayed, she says, in the same hotel as Team Sky, had dinner with the men‚Äôs riders and staff and were part of the support team on race day, holding wheels and water bottles on the side of the road. And from then until the end of 2020, Team Sky and then INEOS gave APB riders equipment, such as wheels, chains, bike bags and cool boxes.

Knaven-den Ouden then set up an under-23 women‚Äôs team, which became a UCI continental team called NXTG Racing. In February 2021, NXTG CEO Marion de Cocq says she sent a proposal via email to INEOS. The vision was to set up a continental team, using NXTG Racing‚Äôs under-23s as a feeder, which would cost an estimated ‚Ç¨1.5million for the first year ‚Äî about three per cent of the INEOS men‚Äôs team‚Äôs ‚Ç¨45m (¬£39.4m/$52.7m at the current rates) budget.

‚ÄúWe need partners who think outside of the box, who want to innovate and pioneer,‚Äù it read, according to two people who have seen the email. ‚ÄúTogether with INEOS, we can create history in cycling.‚Äù

Knaven-den Ouden and De Cocq say they never received a reply. INEOS declined to comment.

There were other opportunities to invest in women‚Äôs cycling, however.

In November 2022, INEOS signed France‚Äôs reigning mountain bike and gravel world champion Pauline Ferrand-Prevot on a two-year contract. She had gold at the 2024 Paris Olympics in her sights, which she duly won, but INEOS did not build a team around Ferrand-Prevot, who then returned to road racing, signed for Visma-Lease A Bike and won the 2025 Tour de France Femmes.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôve given so many young British men a start in the sport at that level,‚Äù says the same former professional cyclist quoted earlier in this article. ‚ÄúThey really have the opportunity to lift up women‚Äôs cycling in Britain in the same way. They signed quality male cyclists, but are only going to sign the top woman ever.‚Äù

INEOS has two women among 65 staff members on the racing side, and 12 of 85 overall when including administrative personnel. Visma-Lease A Bike, Ferrand-Prevot‚Äôs new team, has 29 female staff overall.

The same former professional cyclist described INEOS as a ‚Äúmen‚Äôs‚Äô club‚Äù with an ‚Äúold-school, blokey mentality‚Äù that is ‚Äúpalpable‚Äù around the cycling paddock. ‚ÄúIt wouldn‚Äôt be a welcoming place for a female team unless they have the staff dedicated to making a concerted shift in the culture,‚Äù was the person‚Äôs verdict.

The America‚Äôs Cup is the oldest international sports competition, and one the British entrant has not won since 1851.

Ratcliffe, though, loves a challenge and invested in INEOS‚Äô Britannia‚Äôs campaigns in the 36th and 37th America‚Äôs Cups in 2021 and 2024, led by team principal and skipper Sir Ben Ainslie. Its financial accounts detail a total of ¬£226.5million of sponsorship income from 2019 to 2024, though there were other sponsorship sources besides INEOS.

In order to compete in the 2024 America‚Äôs Cup, each team had to supply a women‚Äôs and youth team for their respective regattas.

Britain entered under the name Athena Pathway, part of Ainslie‚Äôs Athena Sports Group, which was set up in 2022 by the world‚Äôs most successful Olympic sailors, Ainslie and Hannah Mills. The programme gives women and younger sailors, male and female, more opportunities in high-performance sailing and tries to increase diversity in the sport.

The women‚Äôs edition was the first in history but Athena Pathway had no involvement with or sponsorship from INEOS. Instead, it was sponsored by Cobham-Ultra, an innovator in aerospace and maritime technology. By contrast, Italy, France, Switzerland, New Zealand and the United States all sponsored their men‚Äôs, women‚Äôs and youth teams in their respective regattas.

INEOS‚Äô website proudly details how INEOS Britannia ‚Äúmade history as the first British team in 60 years to reach the Cup Match, the first in 90 years to score points, and the first ever to win the Challenger Series ‚Äî marking Britain‚Äôs most successful campaign‚Äù. Athena Pathway women‚Äôs team, led by Mills, also made history by advancing to the final, narrowly finishing second in a single match-race shootout, while the youth team finished third.

In April this year, INEOS Britannia withdrew its challenge for the next America‚Äôs Cup in 2027, saying its decision was due to ‚Äúprotracted negotiations‚Äù with Athena Racing.

Speaking to The Athletic in April, Ainslie said: ‚ÄúWe competed under Athena Pathway and part of the Athena Sports Group. We had some other sponsors, that were fantastic, who came in to back them (the women‚Äôs team). It‚Äôs not for me to comment on INEOS‚Äô approach.‚Äù

On the football front, as well as being co-owners of Manchester United, INEOS has owned Swiss club Lausanne since 2017 and French side Nice since 2019. All three have women‚Äôs teams, and the latter two sport INEOS‚Äô logo on their shirts.

In November 2023, Nice‚Äôs former general manager Jean-Luc Donati¬†told local newspaper Nice-Matin there were more registered girls than boys in their youth sector. His goal was for the senior women‚Äôs team to one day reach the top flight too, and stay there. In the 2023-24 season, Nice‚Äôs women finished fourth in the French second division.

In French football, clubs are associations and the vast majority have just one commercial entity, usually the men‚Äôs team. The rest, such as the men‚Äôs academy, women‚Äôs team and football school fall under the management of the association. They do not tend to generate enough revenue to sustain costs and so require funding from the men‚Äôs side to support them.

The men‚Äôs first-team budget at Nice is estimated to be around ‚Ç¨80million (¬£70m; $93.7m) per year. Before the 2024-25 season, the women‚Äôs team‚Äôs annual budget was around ‚Ç¨1.4m. INEOS reduced that figure to ‚Ç¨1m, and its support has been capped at ‚Ç¨350,000 per year. Also ahead of that same 2024-25 campaign, around 10 players and former head coach Matthieu Esposito‚Äôs assistant and physios left the club, followed by Esposito himself in February.

Before that season, the French Football Federation introduced new rules to professionalise the women‚Äôs second division and stated teams must have a minimum of 11 players under federal contracts, similar to professional contracts, with working hours at least equal to part-time. If not, a club could be fined ‚Ç¨1,250 per match.

Last season, Nice, according to French media, only had three players on such contracts, the lowest in the league. Some teams in division three had more players on federal contracts than they did.

Nice managed to avoid relegation by two points, finishing ninth, last season. They sit in the same position in this campaign.

Lausanne‚Äôs women play in the third division and are the only club in the men‚Äôs elite competition not to have a women‚Äôs team in Switzerland‚Äôs top two divisions.

In November, an article on the club website detailed how the youth team ran laps around a pitch and raised 20,000 Swiss francs (around ¬£18,800; $25,100) to support the women‚Äôs development section. The money, the report stated, will be used to pay for bus travel, team meals and a training camp, as well as team-building activities.

‚ÄúINEOS does not really show it wants to have a truly successful women‚Äôs team,‚Äù says Florian Paccaud, a sports journalist covering women‚Äôs football in Switzerland.

At Manchester United, over two years, INEOS has injected ¬£238.5million into the club, excluding the cost of buying shares.

The women‚Äôs team‚Äôs total expenditure from the 2022-23 and 2023-24 seasons was ¬£16million, as per club accounts. That is slightly inferior to Manchester City (¬£18m) and dwarfed by the outlay at Arsenal (¬£26m) and Chelsea (¬£33m).

Dr Christina Philippou, associate professor in sport finance at the University of Portsmouth, thinks INEOS is missing a trick by not investing 

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs still a lot of potential money coming in,‚Äù says Philippou. ‚ÄúIf you invest, there is potential for money to keep coming your way.

‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt invest now, and others are willing to, that can be very problematic for your brand. You can fall away pretty quickly. Just because you have a big name in men‚Äôs football does not mean you will be thought of from a brand and commercial perspective if your women‚Äôs team is not competitive. That is the problem with not investing‚Ä¶ If you don‚Äôt invest now, you could miss the boat for quite a few years.‚Äù

But, for some, women‚Äôs football is also a corporate social responsibility project or a positive PR move, and old-school perceptions remain.

‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt remove the sexism angle,‚Äù says Philippou, talking generally about the attitude to investment in women‚Äôs football in the UK. ‚ÄúThere is definitely an element of that, and you see it a lot with how women‚Äôs sport is still viewed by executives, fans and media.‚Äù

A major organisation such as INEOS could significantly influence the culture of women‚Äôs sport ‚Äî if it wanted to. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôll be on the wrong side of history if they don‚Äôt,‚Äù says the ex-pro cyclist.

The overwhelming sentiment expressed by many is that 73-year-old Ratcliffe and key decision-makers are from a past generation, one in which women‚Äôs professional sport did not exist in anything like the same way it does today. Ratcliffe, Andrew Currie, John Reece, Jonathan Ginns and Simon Morland form an all-male board at INEOS Limited, the parent company which sits at the top of the sprawling INEOS group. The board‚Äôs average age is 60.

INEOS says it has a number of female CEOs and CEO-level executives, but they are on the petrochemicals side of the organisation. When asked who sits on the INEOS sports board alongside CEO Jean-Claude Blanc, it said it does not publish details of individual board members.

INEOS‚Äô sporting success on the men‚Äôs side has also been mixed, despite the huge investment.

Ratcliffe remarked in March, via BBC Sport, that Manchester United‚Äôs women‚Äôs team ‚Äúare frankly doing better than the men‚Äôs team‚Äù, pointing to their second-place league position at the time and 2024 FA Cup final win, while a sale of Nice is being explored, as reported in May.

Kipchoge‚Äôs feat was historic, but INEOS ended its NN running team partnership and also withdrew from the America‚Äôs Cup challenge, having split with Ainslie in January. INEOS Grenadiers are in decline, registering their worst performance at the Tour de France since 2010 this summer, and INEOS settled a sponsorship dispute with New Zealand Rugby (NZR) in April, and another case with Tottenham Hotspur of the Premier League last month.

‚ÄúFive years ago, they could have done a lot,‚Äù says one observer with experience in the field. ‚ÄúNow‚Ä¶ most people would say, ‚ÄòFocus on what you have, because you‚Äôre not doing very well‚Äô.‚Äù

This article originally appeared in The Athletic.

Manchester United, Premier League, Ligue 1, Sports Business, Women's Soccer, Global Sports, Cycling

2025 The Athletic Media Company

title: NFL power rankings: Seahawks edge Patriots for new No. 1; Jaguars, Bears also rise; Packers fade for Week 17
description: How do all 32 teams in the NFL stack up against each other coming out of Week 16 of the 2025 NFL regular season? Here's an updated look from best to worst.
fullText:
NFL power rankings: Seahawks edge Patriots for new No. 1; Jaguars, Bears also rise; Packers fade for Week 17 originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Ranking all 32 teams in the NFL from best to worst for every week in the 2025 regular season has been a wild ride. With such a top-heavy league, the hierarchy can see a big change based on a few particular results.

That has often caused teams to jump high or fade fast in relation to the others near the top. Even the back end has seen some significant reshuffling of late.

Here's Sporting News' latest breakdown from the tippy top to rock bottom coming out of Week 16:

MORE:¬†Updated AFC, NFC playoff picture after Week 16 results

The Seahawks¬†won that thriller over the Rams with the offense rebounding after a slow passing start. They need Sam Darnold to cut down on the mistakes and keep raising the big plays to live up to their lofty playoff position.

The Patriots¬†went into more of an offensive slump in Baltimore with Drake Maye cooling and being contained again, putting their chances of stealing the AFC East in serious jeopardy.

MORE:¬†Patriots clinch playoff spot for first time since 2021

The Rams¬†had no problems moving the ball without Davante Adams with Matthew Stafford spreading the ball around and getting more from the running game. But the secondary issues in Seattle became more prevalent when the front cannot get pressure.

The Broncos¬†couldn't find enough clean offense from Bo Nix to make another fourth-quarter comeback in what looked more like a blowout loss to the Jaguars. Their defense, having key lapses, is a shaky late development.

The Jaguars¬†had their true statement victory in Denver, making six straight wins. Their road domination and finishing well in the fourth quarter bodes well for their playoff profile.

MORE: 6 reasons why Jaguars are legitimate Super Bowl contenders

The Bears¬†should be thrilled to have the late-game comeback mode of Caleb Williams, always giving them a chance. Chicago is pushing toward being a tough out in the playoffs.

MORE:¬†Bears take control of NFC North with win over Packers

The Bills¬†were caught in a tough battle down the road in Cleveland as Josh Allen's clunker against a tough defense was saved by James Cook and the running game. The defense was fortunate to face a team with limited weapons to survive

The Chargers¬†went into Dallas and used it for a get-well offensive game with more juice from their defense, too. Justin Herbert needed that and so did Jim Harbaugh.

The 49ers¬†should have loved the fact that the Seahawks took down the Rams on Thursday night. Their offense is red-hot and a win over the Colts would give them control of the division in the final two weeks.

The Eagles¬†have got their offensive groove back with Saquon Barkley running well and Jalen Hurts' passing efficiently everywhere to silence the critics. They don't need to worry about the division anymore and can focus on getting into top shape for their Super Bowl defense in the playoffs.

The¬†Packers¬†saw Jordan Love get concussed in Chicago with Malik Willis playing well enough to win, but had too many offensive, defensive and special teams lapses to create a bigger mess than injuries.

The Texans¬†were able to hold off the Raiders with resilient offense and just enough of their trademark defense. The hiccup is excusable with a win, but much must be fixed before facing the Chargers next week.

MORE:¬†Texans keep playoff hopes alive by escaping with win over Raiders

The Steelers¬†found their running game again in Detroit to balance out the stellar run defense. They keep getting better at the right time to get into the playoffs on an uptick with Aaron Rodgers.

The Lions¬†have been struggling to run the ball at will like they did last season and taking that element away, as the Steelers did. That and an injury-depleted defense have been the downfall for Detroit as a playoff contender.

The Panthers¬†showed a lot of moxie in outlasting the Buccaneers with Bryce Young winning the biggest passing duel of his career. They have a great shot at making some noise should they get into the NFC playoffs.

MORE:¬†Panthers take control of NFC South with massive win over Buccaneers

The¬†Colts¬†will try to do more with a game Philip Rivers on Monday night against the 49ers with their season on the line, but the defense also may not oblige in a tough spot.

The Ravens¬†had another defensive meltdown and other fourth-quarter big mistakes to blow another big lead, this time vs. the Patriots, spelling doom for a bad overall season, now maybe with Lamar Jackson not finishing healthy.

MORE:¬†Ravens' path to the postseason gets bleaker with loss to Patriots

The Buccaneers¬†are making too many mistakes late in games, from the defense to Baker Mayfield. They can still get into the playoffs but there will be less inspiration for them to last long against a tough wild-card draw.

The¬†Vikings¬†can't seem to keep J.J. McCarthy healthy right when he builds positive momentum, but they still grounded out another win with enough clutch plays and more needed tough defense against what was a promising Giants offense.

The Cowboys¬†look like they're running out of gas offensively to keep trying to make up for historically horrible all-around defense. This disappointment can't be blamed on Dak Prescott.

The¬†Falcons¬†are working to finish strong with wins over the Buccaneers and Cardinals making them feel better about the future of Raheem Morris as head coach. Credit Morris for getting them to be inspired with nothing left on the line.

The Chiefs¬†can't be expected to win with their defense not having a pass rush and their offense not having a passing game minus Patrick Mahomes, Gardner Minshew and their top wide receiver. The fact they lost so easily on the road to the Titans is just so shocking.

MORE:¬†How Travis Kelce's retirement decision is easy with no Patrick Mahomes

The Saints¬†took care of the lesser Jets at home with Tyler Shough chucking well with help from diverse weapons under Kellen Moore. He should go into Year 2 as the starting QB and the defense is also playing with a lot of late conviction.

The¬†Bengals¬†showed almost no life in Week 15 against the Ravens but got up off the mat to rip an overmatched and lesser-motivated Dolphins team with Joe Burrow needing that get-well performance late to try to end the season on a positive.

The Dolphins¬†have faded fast from their rally back into playoff contention with dismal performances against the Steelers and Bengals in consecutive losses. Mike McDaniel can feel the heat again with the Tua Tagovailoa benching backfiring.

The Commanders¬†just haven't fielded enough reliable defense all season long, with their age and youth showing in all the wrong places. They will just hope everything will change again with a healthy Jayden Daniels leading the offense.

The Titans¬†are seeing a much-improved Cam Ward in recent weeks and it added up to a nice confidence-building win against the reeling Chiefs at home.

The Browns¬†fought hard against the Bills with Shedeur Sanders showing the kind of fight and play that gets him a full-season audition as the starter in 2026 despite the defense falling apart around Myles Garrett.

MORE:¬†Myles Garrett inches closer to NFL sack record with obscure half sack

The Cardinals' positive offensive vibes have hit a wall with Jacoby Brissett and the rest of their backups, who have had too much pressure to compensate for a Jonathan Gannon potential lame-duck defense.

The Jets¬†did their best to stay competitive with Brady Cook starting again at quarterback but the bigger problem is Aaron Glenn's shell of an overall defense. They are a really lost, bad team.

MORE:¬†Updated NFL draft order after Week 16

Jaxson Dart was due for a clunker and the Vikings' defense delivered it to him. The lumps have been there enough to go forward with a new coaching system all-around.

The¬†Raiders¬†showed more life with their offense in of all places, Houston against the Texans' nasty defense. They also played their most inspired defensive game in weeks. It still wasn't enough to overcome their lack of execution.

title: Clayton Keller Gives Utah an Early Christmas Gift, Mammoth Win 4-3 in Overtime Over Jets
description: ‚ÄôTwas the last night at Delta Center, and the Utah Mammoth played Winnipeg on the Sabbath.
fullText:
‚ÄôTwas the last night at Delta Center, and the Utah Mammoth played Winnipeg on the Sabbath.

Not a player was scoring ‚Äî except Clayton Keller, whose overtime goal was so good it even surprised Tusky the Mammoth.

THE CAPTAIN GETS IT DONE ü´°

Clayton Keller scores the winner in @Energizer overtime! pic.twitter.com/lwC8no1aOM

Coming away with a 4-3 overtime win against the Winnipeg Jets, Keller and the Utah Mammoth delivered the best gift a Mammoth fan could ask for ‚Äî an exciting overtime win at home ahead of the Christmas break.

But perhaps Dylan Guenther was the one who gave the best gift during this game, as he opted to give the puck up to Keller rather than take a shot of his own despite it having an open look.

"Me and Gunner [Guenther] actually chatted before overtime started," said Keller. "He was like, let's come with a lot of speed and, you know, I think that was something that was in my head as I came on the ice."

Additionally, Guenther gave Keller a new record, as he recorded the fastest goal in Utah Mammoth history, scoring just 13 seconds into overtime and overtaking Lawson Crouse‚Äôs previous mark of 16 seconds against the Kraken on April 8.

Knowing Guenther‚Äôs success ‚Äî he has scored a game-winning goal in 19 of his 186 NHL games ‚Äî it would have come as no surprise if he elected to shoot the puck himself. He was coming in with plenty of speed on a 2-on-1 and was in a great position to shoot.

That‚Äôs just it, though. Everyone in the stands, Jets goalie Connor Hellebuyck and maybe even the Utah bench was thinking Guenther would take the shot.

So rather than trying to add another overtime game-winner under his belt ‚Äî specifically his fourth of the season had he scored the goal‚Äî Guenther made the smart play and passed the puck to a wide-open Keller.

"You cannot teach that. You just make the right play," said Andr√© Tourigny. "If we will have odds to know 'Does he shoot that puck?,' the entire building will have said he will have [shot] it. The goalie probably thought the same. That's why he passed it."

It may have looked a bit different for Guenther, but the result was the same: The Utah Mammoth got a win, thanks in part to his play.

Guenther is sure to be happy adding an overtime game-winning assist to his r√©sum√©, especially if it meant giving his captain a game-winner of his own.

It is the season of giving, after all.

No lead is safe in the NHL, and Utah knows that very well thanks to its last overtime win ‚Äî a 5-4 victory against the Penguins in which Utah came back from three goals down. Fittingly, Guenther scored the overtime goal in that game.

But in this game, it was Winnipeg fighting for a comeback, not the Mammoth.

Down 3-0 just three minutes into the second period, the Jets were struggling to keep the Mammoth away from their own net. Every attempt to clear the puck was met by a Utah player‚Äôs stick jarring it loose, leading to long shifts in the offensive zone and even a couple of goals going the Mammoth's way.

JJ makes it 2-0! Way to play, fellas! üî• pic.twitter.com/WNqRQZRJlW

‚Äî Utah Mammoth (@utahmammoth) December 22, 2025

To make matters worse, three of Utah‚Äôs four lines found themselves getting the puck into the back of the net, including fourth-liner Alexander Kerfoot, who scored in just his second game back from injury after missing Utah's first 36 games.

The Mammoth were scoring at will, and it didn‚Äôt matter who was on the ice. But just as things were beginning to look bleak, the Jets dug deeper and began to play harder.

At first, it started with just a couple of hard hits when Utah entered its offensive zone. Rather than letting Utah make any pass it wanted, Winnipeg upped its physicality and forced Utah to endure big hits.

It was a small change, but it showed the Jets were done allowing the Mammoth easy access to the net. Thanks to that physicality, Winnipeg eventually generated some offense of its own and drew a Utah penalty, with Kyle Connor scoring on the power play.

Mr. 300 goals üö®üçó pic.twitter.com/8sefqxqLmO

‚Äî Winnipeg Jets (@NHLJets) December 22, 2025

The Jets had a long way to go, but they were able to cut Utah‚Äôs lead to 3-1 entering the third period and gained a bit of momentum.

Though Utah played good defense for most of the third, Winnipeg struck, scoring two goals in just 25 seconds to tie the game 3-3, prompting a timeout from Tourigny.

BANG BANG TO TIE IT ‚ÄºÔ∏è pic.twitter.com/emiOSlGi5P

‚Äî Winnipeg Jets (@NHLJets) December 22, 2025

While Keller eventually won the game for the Mammoth in overtime, it still allowed a division rival, fighting for a playoff spot, to snag a point it shouldn't have had.

"I think our third (period) there is obviously not great," said Keller. "We still have to make plays, even if we're winning. Whatever the score is, they're gonna make a push. That's something that we've talked about and tried to get better at... I think that's something that we have to learn from and do moving forward."

But just like the Whos down in Whoville, Utah will still celebrate the win at the end of the day, even if it comes in overtime and the Grinch has already stolen the last can of Who hash.

Are we sure Alexander Kerfoot has only played two games for the Mammoth? Because his performance against the Jets showed no signs of rust.

Already, in just his second game, Kerfoot‚Äôs time on ice has gone drastically up ‚Äî from 8:14 against New Jersey the game prior to 13:49 ‚Äî and he certainly deserves it if he‚Äôs going to keep scoring goals on the fourth line.

Back like he never left! üëè

üö® Kerfy makes it 3-0, Mammoth! pic.twitter.com/3mA0oqkkkS

‚Äî Utah Mammoth (@utahmammoth) December 22, 2025

"He‚Äôs such a great player. He can play anywhere in the lineup. He‚Äôs a great leader, someone that we missed when he was out. Just all the little things that he does on the bench, during the game, in the locker room. I can‚Äôt say enough great things about Kerf and how good of a person he is and player as well," said Keller. "It's awesome getting him back. We definitely have had more juice since he's been back."

Considering how much the Mammoth relied on Kerfoot last year when dealing with injuries, it makes sense that Utah immediately had chemistry with him.

But in addition to his chemistry, Kerfoot is invaluable for Utah‚Äôs penalty kill. Against the Jets, he was already back to his disruptive ways, blocking shots and sending pucks back to Hellebuyck throughout the game.

The Mammoth were already the sixth-best penalty-kill unit in the league, killing 83% of opponent power plays before his return to the lineup. Imagine what Utah will be able to do now that he‚Äôs back in the lineup.

title: Patriots vs. Ravens highlights: 9 moments that defined the Pats‚Äô win
description: Relive the biggest moments from the Patriots‚Äô Week 16 win.
fullText:
The New England Patriots are back in the win column thanks to a 28-24 win over the Baltimore Ravens on Sunday night. The victory, which helped New England secure a spot in the NFL playoffs for the first time since 2021, was hard-earned and saw the team overcome an 11-point deficit in the early fourth quarter.

Here is a Patriots-centric view at some of the key moments of the game.

Derrick Henry's 117th career rushing TD!

NEvsBAL on NBC
Stream on @NFLPlus + Peacock pic.twitter.com/63luTxitUR

The Patriots defense couldn‚Äôt stop a nose bleed in the second half against the Buffalo Bills last Sunday, and things did not start any better against the Ravens. After receiving the opening kickoff, it took Baltimore only five plays to cover 65 yards and find the end zone on a 21-yard untouched Derrick Henry touchdown.

Marlon Humphrey picks off Drake Maye!

NEvsBAL on NBC
Stream on @NFLPlus + Peacock pic.twitter.com/8HQQe2GUE8

Like the Ravens, the Patriots had some success on their opening possession. However, while they managed to drive into the Baltimore red zone their series found a quick and disappointing end: facing a 3rd-and-14, Drake Maye escaped the pocket to his right only to throw an interception to cornerback Marlon Humphrey with wide receiver Kayshon Boutte in the vicinity.

Hawkins knocks the ball loose from Henry for the turnover

NEvsBAL on NBC
Stream on @NFLPlus + Peacock pic.twitter.com/dEZa8NZFCG

After registering just three takeaways in their last six games, New England‚Äôs defense was able to get a big one in the late first quarter. While trying to fight for extra yards, Ravens running back Derrick Henry got the ball punched out on a gang tackle by Jaylinn Hawkins and Carlton Davis. Fellow Patriots DB Craig Woodson fell onto the ball for the recovery, preventing Baltimore from potentially going up by multiple scores.

Maye to Henry to tie it up!

NEvsBAL on NBC
Stream on @NFLPlus + Peacock pic.twitter.com/e2kloG2JrQ

The Patriots took full advantage of their fumble recovery, driving down the field in 10 plays to score their first points of the night. Selling a handoff to Rhamondre Stevenson, Drake Maye found Hunter Henry wide open in the end zone for a 1-yard touchdown to tie the game.

Ar'Darius Washington forces the Drake Maye fumble before half

NEvsBAL on NBC
Stream on @NFLPlus + Peacock pic.twitter.com/iAZblTUjXD

The Patriots had a chance to get the upper hand at the end of the first half, moving into Andy Borregales‚Äô field goal range for a fourth time. However, just like the first of those opportunities, New England came up empty-handed: Drake Maye was sacked from behind, coughing the ball up in the process. The Ravens fell on the fumble for their second takeaway of the game.

The Patriots fake punt cannot convert!

NEvsBAL on NBC
Stream on @NFLPlus + Peacock pic.twitter.com/FN6q20LMae

Facing a 4th-and-10 down four points in the late third quarter, and with the Ravens down to their backup quarterback, the Patriots decided to make a head-scratching decision. Instead of punting the ball, they ran a fake with personal protector Marte Mapu trying to execute a pass. However, the play was doomed from the start and Mapu eventually unable to salvage it. Seven plays later, the Ravens scored a touchdown to go up 24-13.

DRAKE MAYE TO KYLE WILLIAMS.

NEvsBAL on NBC
Stream on @NFLPlus + Peacock pic.twitter.com/ToEf565k29

Down 11 points, the Patriots were in dire need of some offensive momentum. They found it in the form of a big touchdown pass from Drake Maye to Kyle Williams. New England‚Äôs quarterback hit the rookie down the right sideline for a 36-yard score. While not the most actively-involved member of the team‚Äôs wide receiver group, Williams has now caught three touchdowns on the season and is averaging 30 yards per catch. For Maye, meanwhile, the score put him over 300 yards in a game for the first time in his career.

When the Patriots took over with 5:02 left in the game, they were still down three points. While that meant a field goal would tie the game, they had their sights set on victory. And a big fourth-down catch by wide receiver Stefon Diggs helped them accomplish that goal.

Maye. Diggs. 4th down. Clutch.

NEvsBAL on NBC
Stream on @NFLPlus + Peacock pic.twitter.com/6qywqsJnCi

Diggs‚Äô 21-yard gain on 4th-and-2 proved to be pivotal moment for the Patriots. Instead of potentially giving the ball back to Balti

RHAMONDRE FOR THE LEAD.

NEvsBAL on NBC
Stream on @NFLPlus + Peacock pic.twitter.com/VzcKV8z7Wd

The Patriots relied heavily on Rhamondre Stevenson against the Ravens, especially after rookie TreVeyon Henderson was lost to a head injury in the second quarter. Stevenson finished the game with eight carries for 51 yards, and also found the end zone twice: first on a two-point conversion after the Kyle Williams TD, and then on a 21-yard run to put New England up by four just outside the two-minute warning.

CHAISSON FORCES THE FUMBLE.

NEvsBAL on NBC
Stream on @NFLPlus + Peacock pic.twitter.com/k1qFLyors9

The Patriots defense collapsed in the second half against Buffalo last Sunday, but they held firm versus the Ravens. Tasked with preserving a four-point lead inside the two-minute warning, the unit delivered: on one of the better hustle plays you will see, K‚ÄôLavon Chaisson turned from pass rusher to pursuit player to force a Zay Flowers fumble that was recovered by Marcus Jones, giving the Patriots the ball and a chance to run out the clock.

title: Early Week 17 Fantasy QB Rankings: Fantasy championship start-sit quarterbacks, best sleepers, top streamers
description: Check The Sporting News' Week 17 QB fantasy rankings to set your lineups. See Tim Heaney's best matchups, top waiver-wire adds, and sleeper streamers for one-QB, superflex, and 2-QB leagues.
fullText:
Early Week 17 Fantasy QB Rankings: Fantasy championship start-sit quarterbacks, best sleepers, top streamers originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

In most league formats, the¬†fantasy football¬†playoffs start in Week 16. For the quarterback position, all starters are in play -- for better or worse.

Well, except for Patrick Mahomes, who suffered a season-ending torn ACL as the Chiefs' playoff hopes for this season also ended.

Luckily, in most fantasy games, quarterback replacements from the waiver wire at least have a high weekly floor compared to other positions, and Mahomes managers have plenty of replacements.

‚ûï UPGRADE YOUR PLAYOFF TOOLS: 
These Week 17 quarterback rankings are based on 4-point passing touchdowns and one point for every 25 passing yards.

‚ÜïÔ∏è Fantasy Rankings for Week 17

üìã BEST PLAYOFF PICKUPS: Week 17 waiver wire guide

The Ravens' Lamar Jackson (back) left Sunday Night Football with a back injury, replaced by Tyler Huntley.

Jordan Love (concussion) was replaced by Malik Willis during the Packers' Saturday night loss to the rival Bears.

J.J. McCarthy (hand) might need season-ending surgery, leaving the Vikings to be stuck with potentially another Max Brosmer experiment.

Marcus Mariota (throwing hand/quadriceps) day-to-day for the Commanders, leaving the definition of "journeyman" Josh Johnson as a possible replacement with Jayden Daniels (elbow) already shut down for the season.

The Chiefs fear that Gardner Minshew suffered some type of season-ending knee injury. With Patrick Mahomes (torn ACL) already done for the year, that leaves Chris¬†Oladokun as a possibility to take snaps while Kansas City plays out the string on its lost season.

Who's left? Trevor Lawrence has etched his name into the "breakout star" list from this season, who heading into his three-touchdown Week 16 hadn't finished lower than QB13 in his previous six outings -- including back-to-back QB1 overall finishes before Sunday.

The magical Liam Coen potion has revitalized another lost quarterback at the best possible time for fantasy players.

That being said, Lawrence sits behind Drake Maye and Matthew Stafford, who thrived even with Davante Adams (hamstring) on the sidelines.

üêê See where Trevor Lawrence ranks among QBs: Who has the most fantasy points in a game?

While calling them "sleepers" is a stretch, the fact that every healthy QB is available shouldn't keep us from giving these names a boost:

With the surging 49ers' full cast of characters healthy, Brock Purdy is a strong top-5 option against a Bears secondary that caught a break with Jordan Love's injury Saturday. That defensive backfield will¬†wilt against San Francisco's cadre of pass-catchers.

Keep rolling out Joe Burrow (vs. Cardinals) and Dak Prescott (at Commanders), despite both teams' elimination from postseason contention.

The Buccaneers' Baker Mayfield should rebound after a tough draw against the Panthers against a Dolphins defense that won't contain Mike Evans and co.

Tyler Shough (at Titans), Kirk Cousins (vs. Rams), and even Quinn Ewers (vs. Buccaneers) deserve superflex/2QB matchup consideration, too, especially if you've lost Mahomes or Daniels recently and/or could face more injury woes with any of the handful in jeopardy.

NEW - FANTASY TOOLS: NFL Player Stats | NFL Transactions | NFL Depth Charts | Fantasy Injury Reports

We're not keen on taking any of the top 13 quarterbacks out of lineups, but if you're streaming, Sam Darnold could fall short of QB1 expectations against a Panthers defense that can contain top quarterbacks.

Same goes for Justin Herbert, who must deal with the Texans' elite pass defense.

The NFL has no more weekly byes for the 2025 regular season. All active fantasy players are available for lineups.

title: Twitter reacts to Patriots upsetting Ravens, clinching playoff berth
description: Here's how social media reacted to the Patriots' comeback win over the Ravens on Sunday Night Football.
fullText:
The New England Patriots battled back on Sunday night against the Baltimore Ravens and overcame a double-digit deficit to win by a 28-24 margin.

With the victory, the Patriots have officially punched their ticket to the postseason for the first time since the 2021 season. They also have a legitimate shot at winning the No. 1 seed in the AFC conference after the Denver Broncos fell to the Jacksonville Jaguars this week.

Maye eclipsed 300 yards passing for the first time this season by lighting up the Ravens' defense late for 380 passing yards, two touchdowns and one interception. His favorite target in the game was veteran wide receiver Stefon Diggs, who hauled in nine catches for 138 yards.

There were several key injuries in the game, including Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson and Patriots running back TreVeyon Henderson. It was an ugly game that forced the Patriots to dig deep and pull out the kind of performance they wished they had against the Buffalo Bills last week.

Here's what fans were saying on social media after the game:

The Mike Vrabel era is off to a historic start. After a few lean years, New England is back in the hunt with a roster that looks dangerous heading into January.

Drake Maye delivered huge tonight in his first 4Q comeback win and secured a playoff spot for the New England Patriots.

The New England Patriots are finally back in the playoffs!!!!

Drake Maye showing why the future‚Äôs bright in New England. Big win for the Pats üí™#patriots

lobster and football ‚Äî that‚Äôs what new england does https://t.co/uVe7ejA18K

THE NEW ENGLAND PATRIOTS ARE GOING BACK TO THE PLAYOFFS FOR THE FIRST TIME SINCE 2021

 pic.twitter.com/ta70nlEOmD

title: Baltimore Ravens Report Card, Week 16: Another late collapse defined by costly errors
description: Quarterback: B+ Before leaving the game with a back injury late in the second quarter, Lamar Jackson appeared on his way to a strong outing. Jackson had completed 7-of-10 passes for 101 yards and made multiple off-script throws after buying time in the pocket. He connected with Zay Flowers for several long gains through the [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Before leaving the game with a back injury late in the second quarter, Lamar Jackson appeared on his way to a strong outing. Jackson had completed 7-of-10 passes for 101 yards and made multiple off-script throws after buying time in the pocket. He connected with Zay Flowers for several long gains through the air and one of his three incompletions was a dropped pass. In Jackson‚Äôs relief, Tyler Huntley did a respectable job in the second half, leading consecutive touchdown drives at one point. Huntley completed all but one of his 10 pass attempts but only threw for 65 yards, with two yards on the ground.

Derrick Henry‚Äôs lost fumble late in the first quarter was an early negative turning point, as it killed the Ravens‚Äô momentum. They ultimately rebounded enough to take a double-digit lead later in the game. Henry had already rushed for a touchdown and 51 yards before fumbling and rumbled for more production after the blemish. He finished with 128 rushing yards in total on 18 carries with two touchdowns. Henry was strangely on the sidelines for the final two drives of the game despite dominating in the third quarter. It was quiet night from the rest of the running back room. Keaton Mitchell gained only 13 yards on nine carries while Rasheen Ali had two catches for two yards.

Flowers did just about everything right all game until his final touch of the night, where he lost a fumble with just under two minutes remaining. The Ravens may not have driven down the field and scored a go-ahead touchdown anyways, but Flowers‚Äô fumble sealed the fate of a loss. In total, Flowers finished with seven catches for 84 yards and added an 18-yard rushing touchdown in the third quarter. He made big catches and moved the sticks but the fumble, which has been his achilles heal, is a costly blemish. Deandre Hopkins had a strong performance with four receptions for 41 yards with multiple third-down contested catches to extend drives. Rashod Bateman was once again blanked on both his targets and Devontez Walker was not targeted.

Mark Andrews was a minimal factor in the passing game again with just two catches for 21 yards. He almost had a costly turnover as well with a head-scratching lateral pass attempt before halftime. It was ruled an illegal forward throw, which prevented a fumble that would have given the Patriots the ball in scoring range. Charlie Kolar had a nice 18-yard grab and Isaiah Likely was surprisingly not a factor with no targets. The tight ends collectively made a positive impact in run blocking and helped create some lanes for Henry.

Aside from some frustrating false start penalties on the same drive, the Ravens‚Äô offensive line appeared to have one of their better games in recent weeks. Jackson was not sacked in the first half and Huntley was sacked only once across several drives. The Patriots managed five quarterback hits, but Baltimore‚Äôs pass protection was pretty solid. In run blocking, they drove open lanes for Henry all night and also helped create space for Flowers to find the end zone on his 18-yard end-around touchdown. As a team, the Ravens finished with 171 rushing yards and three touchdowns while averaging 5.2 yards per carry.

The Ravens‚Äô defensive line was stout against the run for nearly the entire game, before Rhamondre Stevenson broke them down with a pair of long rushes late in the fourth quarter. Stevenson‚Äôs 21-yard touchdown and 11-yard first down pickup were back-breakers. Drake Maye and Treyveon Henderson were otherwise contained on the ground. In terms of pass rush, the Ravens‚Äô defensive front did very little to get pressure through the interior on Maye. Travis Jones had one quarterback hit, but there was a lack of noticeable push up front.

Speaking of a lack of pass rush, that issue extends outside to the edge rushers as well. The final numbers of four sacks and 10 quarterback hits look good on paper, but too often Maye had clean pockets and plenty of time to throw for multiple plays in a row. Dre‚ÄôMont Jones had another solid showing with a timely sack and two quarterback hits, and Kyle Van Noy broke up a pass attempt that would have been a touchdown catch. The Ravens‚Äô edge rushers deserve some credit for playing solid run defense for much of the game, but they badly needed more juice and disruption.

Roquan Smith recorded a team-high 10 tackles and, along with Trenton Simpson, made some plays against the run. Smith‚Äôs lack of splash plays, however, is disappointing when considering his prominent role. Simpson had a sack and two tackles-for-loss in a starting role with Teddye Buchanan (knee) out for the rest of the year. The former third-round pick had a nice open-field tackle against Henderson. The Patriots were able to complete some longer throws over the middle of the field above the heads of the linebackers. Their tight ends Hunter Henry and Austin Hooper combined for eight catches and 69 yards with a touchdown.

Marlon Humphrey‚Äôs night started off well after he corralled an interception on the Patriots‚Äô opening drive of the game. From there on out, his performance went downhill. Humphrey was beat for a long touchdown in single coverage of Kyle Williams, which gave the Patriots much-needed life in the fourth quarter. He also ceded several catches to Stefon Diggs as the primary defender and should have been called for defensive pass interference on a long pass attempt to Keyshon Boutte late. Nate Wiggins had two pass breakups and nearly came up with a huge interception late in the game. He timed a break on a slant route perfectly but could not pull down the ball, which would have given the Ravens the ball back with the lead and a few minutes remaining. The Ravens surely would have liked to have had the services of Chidobe Awuzie, who was inactive with a foot injury.

Alohi Gilman had an up-and-down night, as he was victimized by some missed open-field tackles but also finished with eight total and a pass breakup as well. Kyle Hamilton had a strong tackle-for-loss to prevent a long Henderson run and a pass breakup of his own, too. Ar‚ÄôDarius Washington was party to one of the defensive plays of the game, where he forced a fumble on Maye just before halftime. That prevented the Patriots from getting a field goal or touchdown and taking a lead into the break. Washington finished with two quarterback hits, a sack, and a tackle-for-loss. He was beaten by Diggs in coverage on a key fourth-and-short pass late in the game. Malaki Starks had three solo tackles on the night.

The play of the game on special teams was the Ravens dismantling a fake punt attempt by the Patriots late in the third quarter, which was defended nicely by Devontez Walker. It wasn‚Äôt a great night for the unit aside from that moment. Tyler Loop was well short on a 56-yard attempt in the second quarter while making his other try and all three extra points. Jordan Stout‚Äôs two punts went for 40 and 45 yards, respectively.

title: ‚ÄòUtah brings out the worst in us‚Äô: Mammoth‚Äôs hot start frustrates Jets, Utah wins in OT
description: It took overtime to get it done, but the Mammoth move into a playoff spot after their 4-3 win over the Jets.
fullText:
If the Utah Mammoth make the playoffs this season, it‚Äôs incredibly likely that the Winnipeg Jets don‚Äôt ‚Äî and vice versa.

For that reason, their matchup on Sunday was among the more important games either team will play this year. The Mammoth pulled off the win, but it took the skin of their teeth to get it done. Here‚Äôs the story.

When the Mammoth took a 3-0 lead 23 minutes in, it looked like they‚Äôd waltz away with a regulation win against the Jets for the second time this season.

But hockey is a 60-minute game. It doesn‚Äôt end when one team takes a three-goal lead.

Kyle Connor began the Jets‚Äô comeback with a power play goal midway through the second period. He doubled up with a nearly identical tally late in the third, and 15 seconds later, Morgan Barron struck to tie the game.

‚ÄúWe would have loved to close the game right there. I think we got a little bit nervous,‚Äù said Mammoth head coach Andr√© Tourigny. ‚ÄúWe lost our composure with the puck. I often say there‚Äôs two (important things) when you‚Äôre protecting a lead: Having poise with the puck ... and to have a lot of pace defensively, which is our strength.

‚Äú... We became a little bit too conservative and they were able to come back.‚Äù

If there‚Äôs one aspect of Utah‚Äôs game that strikes fear into opponents, though, it‚Äôs when Dylan Guenther has the puck in overtime.

He‚Äôs tied for the league lead in both overtime goals and game-winning goals this season, and he finished in the top six in both categories last year.

On Sunday, it was his passing that made him a threat.

Guenther collected the puck in the defensive zone, dipsy-doodled around his man in the neutral zone and found Clayton Keller in the offensive zone.

All it took was a perfectly placed shot for the captain to net the OT winner.

CLAYTON KELLER OT FIST BUMPS! pic.twitter.com/1XAZqc8kdk

‚Äî Utah Mammoth (@utahmammoth) December 22, 2025

Utah winning in regulation prevents the other team from getting a point in the standings, so given the tightness of the playoff race the Mammoth would have liked to get it done earlier, but this was their second-best outcome.

‚ÄúUtah brings out the worst in us,‚Äù said Jets head coach Scott Arniel after the game. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a bad start by everybody, and it just got us behind the 8-ball and then we‚Äôre chasing the game.‚Äù

Of course, some of Arniel‚Äôs greatest success came in Utah: He won the Turner Cup while playing for the Utah Grizzlies in 1996.

After returning from the first long-term injury of his NHL career last Friday, there was a question mark regarding how quickly Alexander Kerfoot would be able to get back to his old self.

He‚Äôd played the second-fewest minutes on the team against the New Jersey Devils on Friday and he hadn‚Äôt participated in a single proper practice this season until Saturday.

Nobody would have blamed him for taking a few games to get his stride back, but he didn‚Äôt waste any time.

Kerfoot scored on Sunday, sneaking behind the Jets‚Äô defenseman and sending a perfect one-timer past Connor Hellebuyck, who‚Äôs widely considered the best goalie in the world.

Additionally, Kerfoot played a perfect 1:39 on the penalty kill and increased his ice time by more than five and a half minutes game over game.

Back like he never left! üëè

üö® Kerfy makes it 3-0, Mammoth! pic.twitter.com/3mA0oqkkkS

‚Äî Utah Mammoth (@utahmammoth) December 22, 2025

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs such a great player,‚Äù Keller said of Kerfoot. ‚ÄúHe can play up and down the lineup. He‚Äôs a great leader. Something that we missed while he was out, like, just all the little things that he does on the bench, during the game, in the locker room, like, I can‚Äôt say enough great things about Kerf and how good of a person he is ‚Äî and player as well."

For the second time in his NHL career, Sean Durzi is on a five-game point streak. He also has six points in his last seven games.

He‚Äôs done it quietly, though: a goal here, an assist there. Utah‚Äôs second power play unit, which he quarterbacks, has shown vast improvement in recent weeks and for the most part, Durzi has been good defensively, too.

Tourigny chalked it up to good chemistry between Durzi and his defense partner, Mikhail Sergachev, who added a pair of assists on Sunday for eight points in his last 10 games.

‚ÄúDurz, every game, makes really good plays,‚Äù Tourigny said. ‚ÄúHe needs to keep improving his consistency. The upside is there. The fact he missed a lot of hockey two seasons in a row, sometimes can affect his consistency.

‚ÄúThat said, lately he‚Äôs getting better every game, so we like that.‚Äù

Every good team has a reliable top defense pairing that‚Äôs capable of playing big minutes while keeping the puck out of their net and contributing frequent offense. If Durzi and Sergachev can keep this type of play up over long stretches, the Mammoth will be in a good position going forward.

On a night when Sidney Crosby passed Mario Lemieux for most points in Pittsburgh Penguins franchise history, Kyle Connor won‚Äôt get as many flowers as he otherwise might, so we‚Äôll give him some here.

Connor scored career goals number 300 and 301 on Sunday, and they‚Äôve all come in a Jets uniform. He trails only Mark Scheifele and Ilya Kovalchuk for most goals in franchise history, and he‚Äôs second in that category since the franchise‚Äôs move to Winnipeg.

On the league-wide all-time list, he jumped active San Jose Sharks forward Tyler Toffoli and tied himself with Ulf Dahlen for 239th place, and at age 29, he has plenty of time left to soar much higher.

Also, he‚Äôs the second-fastest American to reach the 300-goal plateau.

‚ÄúPretty cool milestone,‚Äù Connor said after the game. ‚ÄúOnce you look back on your career, that‚Äôs the kind of stuff you‚Äôll remember, but right now, it‚Äôs focusing on winning and trying to be the best player I can and help out, so it doesn‚Äôt really mean much right now.‚Äù

At this point last season, Lawson Crouse had six goals and nine points. This year, he‚Äôs at nine and 15, respectively ‚Äî a pace much closer to what his norm from Arizona.

‚ÄúI think probably my mindset,‚Äù he said when asked what the difference between the two seasons is. ‚ÄúTrying not to let little things bother me, try to be a little bit easier on myself, and I think that‚Äôs been paying off.‚Äù

What a shot from the Sheriff! ü§†

1-0, Utah! pic.twitter.com/CsNxm4M7S7

‚Äî Utah Mammoth (@utahmammoth) December 22, 2025

title: Drake Maye‚Äôs MVP Odds Rise After Patriots Beat Ravens
description: The Patriots celebrated a crucial victory on ‚ÄúSunday Night Football,‚Äù defeating the Baltimore Ravens 28-24. This win not only secured New England a playoff spot but also boosted quarterback Drake Maye‚Äôs standing in the MVP race. Maye threw for 380 yards, completing two touchdowns and one interception. As of Monday, FanDuel listed Maye with the [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The Patriots celebrated a crucial victory on ‚ÄúSunday Night Football,‚Äù defeating the Baltimore Ravens 28-24. This win not only secured New England a playoff spot but also boosted quarterback Drake Maye‚Äôs standing in the MVP race.

Maye threw for 380 yards, completing two touchdowns and one interception. As of Monday, FanDuel listed Maye with the second-best odds to win the MVP at +170, just behind Los Angeles Rams quarterback Matthew Stafford, who is at -195.

Stafford and the Rams lost to the Seattle Seahawks on Thursday. However, the defeat wasn‚Äôt due to Stafford‚Äôs performance, as he threw for an impressive 457 yards and three touchdowns.

Maye still has a shot at winning MVP, but he‚Äôll need Stafford to struggle in the next couple of weeks. Los Angeles will face the Atlanta Falcons and the Arizona Cardinals during that time, both of which are teams already eliminated from postseason contention, which could make it hard for Stafford to struggle.

Maye will have an opportunity to improve his stats when the Patriots play against the New York Jets and the Miami Dolphins the next two weeks.

Even if Maye doesn‚Äôt win the MVP this season, he will likely have a chance to earn the award in the coming years if he keeps up his impressive performance.

Mike Vrabel Gives Honest Reaction To Patriots‚Äô Playoff-Clinching Win

title: Braves News: Andruw Jones, Starting Pitching, More
description: How is early voting looking for Andruw Jones and the Hall of Fame?
fullText:
With the week of Christmas here, many of the top free agents in baseball remained unsigned. This includes some of the best starting pitching arms, including Framber Valdez, Zac Gallen, Ranger Suarez, and Tatsuya Imai. While this development is not entirely surprising, the timing of when signings could occur now becomes a bit harder to predict, especially with the holidays over the next two weeks.

The Braves likely remain involved in many of the conversations focusing on adding a starting pitcher. And with the added bonus of not having traded away any prospects to feel their offseason needs, they could always pivot to the trade market as well. The good thing is that many avenues remain available for the Braves to strengthen their already strong rotation, even if it could into the new year when the move finally occurs.

We are less than away from the 2026 MLB Hall of Fame class being announced, which currently is scheduled for 01/20/2026/. In the very early going, Andruw Jones and Carlos Beltran are at the top of the class in votes. Both are at 78% per Ryan Thibodaux‚Äôs vote tracking on BlueSky. While this should be taking with a grain of salt with less than 10% of the votes known, it is an encouraging start.

Munetaka Murakami signed a two-year, $34M deal with the Chicago White Sox. With his deadline to sign happening Monday, Murakami found a home in Chicago that he hopes can lead to a bigger deal down the road.

The Blue Jays are the latest team to reportedly have interest in Alex Bregman.

title: Watch Jalen Brunson drop 47 on Heat, most he's ever scored at Madison Square Garden
description: Mikal Bridges scored 24 points and shot 6-of-7 from 3-point range, but Karl-Anthony Towns struggled and had just two points.
fullText:
The MVP of the NBA Cup is not slowing down.

Jalen Brunson dropped a season-high 47 ‚Äî also his Madison Square Garden career high ‚Äî on the Miami Heat Sunday, lifting the Knicks to a key East win.

JALEN BRUNSON NEW CAREER HIGH AT MSG 

 47 PTS (MSG career-best)
 8 AST 
 6 3PM

Knicks get their 7th win in 8 games! pic.twitter.com/fcI9B1znra

Knicks coach Mike Brown continued his public campaign for Brunson as MVP after the game, and he needed a night like that from Brunson because Karl-Anthony Towns had just two points on 1-of-5 shooting.

Brunson had plenty of help from Mikal Bridges, who scored 24 points (hitting 6-of-7 from 3-point range, OG Anunoby scored all 18 of his points in the second half, and Josh Hart added 13 points and 10 rebounds. Brunson and Bridges carried the Knicks early, scoring 45 of New York's 66 first-half points.

Kel'el Ware had a monster night for Miami, scoring 28 points with 19 rebounds.

title: Harry Kane becomes the quickest player in Bundesliga history to reach 100 goal contributions
description: Bayern Munich returned to winning ways yesterday, claiming an emphatic 4-0 away win over Heidenheim with Harry Kane putting the gloss on proceedings, bagging the final goal in 90+2.The England interna...
fullText:
Bayern Munich returned to winning ways yesterday, claiming an emphatic 4-0 away win over Heidenheim with Harry Kane putting the gloss on proceedings, bagging the final goal in 90+2.

The England international missed some big chances earlier but eventually netted to take his tally of goals in 2025 for club and country to 60.

He has registered 30 goals in 25 appearances this season.

Kane has now tallied 19 goals and three assists in the Bundesliga this season, taking him to 100 goal contributions (81G & 19A) in only 78 appearances, becoming the fastest player to do so.

He has surpassed the record previously held by Bayern legend Arjen Robben, who took 119 games to reach the 100-mark tally.

Interestingly, Kane also captained Bayern in the absence of Manuel Neuer and Joshua Kimmich, jumping ahead of the queue for the armband due to his leadership qualities.

No one has more goal contributions than the Bayern ace in Europe‚Äôs top five leagues in the past three seasons.

Kane has continued to break record after record in Germany. Just weeks ago, he became the fastest player to reach 10 hat-tricks, achieving it after just 76 Bundesliga appearances.

It took the great Robert Lewandowski 324 games to tally that figure.

Kane looks set to spearhead Bayern to another Bundesliga crown, and Die Rekordmeister will have one eye on the UEFA Champions League title.

With the mercurial Englishman leading the line, they can claim that elusive seventh Champions League crown.

Elsewhere, England boss Thomas Tuchel will be hoping the 32-year-old can avoid any serious injuries and carry this form till the end of the season.

The Three Lions head to the 2026 World Cup at the end of the season as one of the favourites for the title, and Kane will be key to their chances of success.

He has been excellent under Tuchel, and the German tactician will be banking on the former Tottenham Hotspur star to fire England over the line.

title: 'Incredible' Rice is 'future captain of England' - Rooney
description: Former England forward Wayne Rooney hails Arsenal midfielder Declan Rice as a "future captain of England".
fullText:
Former England striker Wayne Rooney has hailed Arsenal midfielder Declan Rice as a "future captain" of the Three Lions after watching the 26-year-old help the Gunners return to the top of the Premier League with victory at Everton.

Rooney, who captained England for three years from 2014 to 2017, was at the Hill Dickinson Stadium to see Mikel Arteta's side secure a scrappy 1-0 win on Saturday evening.

Rice, who has won 72 caps at senior international level, has worn the armband twice before in the absence of current skipper Harry Kane ‚Äì in a 2-2 draw with Belgium in March 2024 and a 3-0 win over Wales in October this year.

"For me, he's the one who's probably waiting for Harry to hang up his boots at some point," Rooney said in the latest episode of BBC Sport's The Wayne Rooney Show.

"He was all over the pitch [against Everton]. His decision-making ‚Äì when to pass it, where to pass it, what foot to pass it to, his detail on his pass ‚Äì it was a pleasure to watch. He was absolutely incredible.

"He was splitting centre-backs, taking the ball off [Arsenal's] centre-backs, acting as a third centre-back, then next minute he's in the box, trying to score a goal. Sometimes, some of the stuff he does is a bit underrated.

"He's the right one to take over [Kane] for me, because [of] his drive, his personality. Everyone seems to love him, who knows him, who's close to him. He's irreplaceable for England."

After a difficult start to his Leeds United career, Rooney's former Everton team-mate Dominic Calvert-Lewin has hit a purple patch in recent weeks.

The 28-year-old had scored just once in 10 league appearances prior to Leeds' 3-2 defeat at Manchester City last month but has now found the net in each of his past five outings, scoring twice in Saturday's 4-1 win over Crystal Palace at Elland Road.

Rooney feels the striker could yet force his way into Thomas Tuchel's squad for next summer's World Cup in the USA, Mexico and Canada.

"If he continues this, then there's no reason why he shouldn't be talked about ‚Äì or even get an opportunity ‚Äì to go to the World Cup, purely because of the lack of forwards England have got," Rooney said.

"He competes, he's great in the air, he's good in both boxes. When he's in a run of form and scoring goals like he is, he's a handful to play against.

"You forget, he's still quite young, he's still got a bit left in him and you forget how good a player he is."

Calvert-Lewin scored 71 goals during his time at Everton but only found the net three times in his final season with the club, missing over three months of the campaign with a hamstring injury.

"I think Everton made the right decision [to let him go]," Rooney continued. "Over the past couple of seasons, he was never fit, really, and he was out of contract.

"It would have been very difficult for Everton to give him a new contract with his injury record, but he's gone to Leeds, kept himself fit. The physios are doing a good job with him there."

Despite scoring the only goal against David Moyes' side, Arsenal striker Viktor Gyokeres has struggled for form since his summer move from Sporting.

The Sweden international's emphatic penalty was his seventh goal in all competitions this season ‚Äì and first since a 2-0 victory at Burnley on 1 November.

Rooney, though, feels Gyokeres should not only be judged by his goalscoring record.

"He does a bit more than what you see," he said. "Even [on Saturday], he occupies the two centre-backs, [James] Tarkowski and Michael Keane. That creates a bit more space for your number 10 or your wide players who are coming inside.

"I think he's important for Arsenal. He's doing a job which helps other players, he just hasn't got the goals which you'd expect from him.

"You maybe don't see it, it's not eye-catching, but he does occupy the centre-back. Can he be better? Of course he can. Should he score more goals playing in that team? Yeah, he should.

"But I think if Arsenal go on to win the league, then he'll have had a big role to play, definitely."

Listen to the latest Football Daily podcast

Get football news sent straight to your phone

title: Duke Smashes Belmont On The Road, 76-46
description: With the win over Belmont, Duke moves back to .500.
fullText:
Duke struggled to open the season and has taken some time to right the ship. Recently though, the Blue Devils got impressive wins over Virginia Tech, South Dakota State and now on the road over Belmont.

Duke won 76-46 behind a tremendous game from Toby Fournier. The sophomore star finished with 26 points (9-15/1-2), 16 rebounds, three blocks, on assist and one steal. That‚Äôs a great game by any standard.

Riley Nelson finished with 17 while Ashlon Jackson had 8 assists.

Duke held Belmont to 17% on threes and 27% overall.

Our apologies for posting this late.
