title: Colorado governor accuses Trump of playing 'political games' after disaster request denials
description: Colorado Gov. Jared Polis accused President Donald Trump of playing ‚Äúpolitical games‚Äù Sunday after the Trump administration denied disaster declaration requests following wildfires and flooding in the state earlier this year.  Polis' office said he received late Saturday two denial letters from the Federal Emergency Management Agency.  The letters follow requests for major disaster declarations following wildfires and mudslides in August and what Polis had described as ‚Äúhistoric flooding‚Äù across southwest Colorado in October.
fullText:
DENVER (AP) ‚Äî Colorado Gov. Jared Polis accused President Donald Trump of playing ‚Äúpolitical games‚Äù Sunday after the Trump administration denied disaster declaration requests following wildfires and flooding in the state earlier this year.

Polis' office said he received late Saturday two denial letters from the Federal Emergency Management Agency. The letters follow requests for major disaster declarations following wildfires and mudslides in August and what Polis had described as ‚Äúhistoric flooding‚Äù across southwest Colorado in October.

Polis and Colorado's U.S. senators, fellow Democrats Michael Bennet and John Hickenlooper, decried the denials. Polis said the state would appeal.

‚ÄúColoradans impacted by the Elk and Lee fires and the flooding in Southwestern Colorado deserve better than the political games President Trump is playing," he said in a statement.

Abigail Jackson, a White House spokesperson, said Trump responds to each request for federal disaster assistance ‚Äúwith great care and consideration, ensuring American tax dollars are used appropriately and efficiently by the states to supplement ‚Äî not substitute, their obligation to respond to and recover from disasters.‚Äù

Jackson said there is ‚Äúno politicization‚Äù to Trump's decisions on disaster aid.

Trump has raised the idea of ‚Äúphasing out‚Äù FEMA, saying he wants states to take more responsibility. States already take the lead in disasters, but federal assistance comes into play when the needs exceed what they can manage on their own.

title: Country music singer arrested on vehicular homicide charge
description: It's the latest disturbing incident for the 38-year-old.
fullText:
Kata Hay, a country music singer who gained fame as a contestant on ‚ÄúThe Voice,‚Äù has been arrested in Tennessee and has been charged with vehicular homicide.

Hay, whose real name is Kata Huddleston, was taken into custody after the Goodlettsville Police Department put out a BOLO for earlier in the week.

That alert said that the singer, who is 38, had ‚Äúoutstanding warrants for vehicular homicide in connection with a motor vehicle crash on Long Hollow Pike near I-65.‚Äù

The police said at the time that they ‚Äúhad reason to believe she may be enroute to Oklahoma and traveling with a white male and quite possibly towing a large camper.‚Äù

Goodlettsville Police followed up with a post on Dec. 17 announcing that Huddleston had been arrested in Oklahoma and was being extradited back to Davidson Country.

Whiskey Riff said this is the latest in a string of troubling incidents for Huddleston.

The outlet said she is currently also facing a DUI charge and a charge of leaving the scene of an accident over $1,500 in damage and open container. Huddleston was also on probation for a 2017 DUI in Nashville, according to Whiskey Riff.

And, according to WKRN, the singer was sentenced to six months in jail after pleading guilty to having sexual contact with a minor.

Huddleston made it onto ‚ÄúThe Voice‚Äù for its 10th season. She was on Christina Aguilera‚Äôs team and made it into the top 20 before being eliminated in the first week of playoffs.

Country music star opens up on retirement at 60: ‚ÄòI‚Äôm not a young man anymore‚Äô

Country music star reveals heartbreaking death: ‚ÄòBroken, empty and a little bit lost‚Äô

Country music star breaks silence on accusations of satanism

title: ‚Äò60 Minutes‚Äô Abruptly Pulls Segment on Trump Deportees Sent to El Salvador Megaprison
description: "60 Minutes" abruptly dropped a segment about Trump deportees sent to a megaprison in El Salvador Sunday ‚Äî two hours before it was set to air.
fullText:
‚Äú60 Minutes‚Äù abruptly pulled a segment Sunday on the Trump administration deporting hundreds of Venezuelan migrants to a megaprison in El Salvador, a stunning move that comes on the heels of President Donald Trump complaining that the CBS newsmagazine has ‚Äútreated him far worse‚Äù under new management.

For days, CBS had been promoting Sunday‚Äôs segment, ‚ÄúInside CECOT,‚Äù which promised to reveal ‚Äúbrutal and torturous conditions‚Äù inside El Salvador‚Äôs Terrorism Confinement Center. Correspondent Sharyn Alfonsi¬†had spoken to now released deportees, according to a Friday press release. But the segment was pulled Sunday evening, around two hours before it was to set to air.

‚ÄúThe 60 Minutes report on ‚ÄòInside CECOT‚Äô will air in a future broadcast,‚Äù CBS told TheWrap in a statement. ‚ÄúWe determined it needed additional reporting.‚Äù

Alfonsi sent an indignant internal memo to colleagues saying that pulling the segment ‚Äúis not an editorial decision, it is a political one.‚Äù The memo was immediately leaked.

She wrote: ‚ÄúIf the standard for airing a story is that ‚Äòthe government must agree to be interviewed,‚Äô then the government effectively gains control over the 60 Minutes broadcast. We go from an investigative powerhouse to a stenographer for the state.‚Äù

Here is Sharyn Alfonsi‚Äôs email to her ‚Äò60 Minutes‚Äô colleagues in full: pic.twitter.com/ilGoSROQEs

‚Äî Michael M. Grynbaum (@grynbaum) December 22, 2025

Alfonsi said the segment had been screened and fact-checked by CBS lawyers and Standards and Practices. Editor-in-chief Bari Weiss, who watched it Friday, decided to hold it.

Weiss responded on Sunday: ‚ÄúMy job is to make sure that all stories we publish are the best they can be.¬†Holding stories that aren‚Äôt ready for whatever reason‚Äîthat they lack sufficient context, say, or that they are missing critical voices‚Äîhappens every day in every newsroom. I look forward to airing this important piece when it‚Äôs ready.‚Äù

But the decision to pull such a heavily promoted and presumably hard-hitting segment on the Trump administration is sure to come under intense scrutiny given the president‚Äôs recent comments about ‚Äú60 Minutes‚Äù and his relationship with David Ellison, who now runs CBS News-parent Paramount.

Social media exploded on Sunday night with criticism of Weiss, declaring that she had failed her own standard that she announced in ascending to the role of running CBS News, ‚Äúto seek the truth and tell it plainly.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf this decision is not reversed, if CBS News will only run a piece if WH comments, giving them veto power over journalism, any staff member w integrity will likely quit, bc it isn‚Äôt a news division anymore. It‚Äôs TASS,‚Äù said veteran reporter Bill Carter, referring to the Soviet-era news agency.

If this decision is not reversed, if CBS News will only run a piece if WH comments, giving them veto power over journalism, any staff member w integrity will likely quit, bc it isn't a news division anymore. It's TASS. https://t.co/RjjZNX7nHm

‚Äî Bill Carter (@wjcarter) December 22, 2025

But ‚Äú60 Minutes‚Äù has lately run afoul of Trump yet again. Earlier this month, after ‚Äú60 Minutes‚Äù aired an interview with his former ally turned critic Marjorie Taylor Greene, Trump referenced the settlement in taking aim at ownership.

Last week, Trump unloaded again, ‚ÄúFor those people that think I am close with the new owners of CBS, please understand that ‚Äò60 Minutes‚Äô has treated me far worse since the so-called ‚Äòtakeover,‚Äô than they have ever treated me before. If they are friends, I‚Äôd hate to see my enemies.‚Äù

Trump sued CBS last year over how ‚Äú60 Minutes‚Äù edited an interview with his then-2024 rival, Kamala Harris. The network initially dismissed Trump‚Äôs suit as ‚Äúwithout merit‚Äù and vowed to ‚Äúvigorously defend‚Äù itself. But CBS-parent Paramount settled with Trump for $16 million in July as the company was seeking FCC approval to merge with Ellison‚Äôs Skydance.

Since the merger, Ellison appointed Weiss, the co-founder of the Free Press, to serve as editor-in-chief. Trump has praised Weiss in the past, as well as Ellison, who is now vying to takeover Warner Bros. Discovery, the parent company of CNN. Ellison‚Äôs father, billionaire Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison, is a Trump supporter.

Trump returned to ‚Äú60 Minutes‚Äù last month for his first interview since the settlement. ‚ÄúI see good things happening in the news. I really do. And I think one of the best things to happen is this show and new ownership, CBS and new ownership,‚Äù Trump said. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs the greatest thing that‚Äôs happened in a long time to a free and open and good press.‚Äù

Watch a teaser for the ‚Äú60 Minutes‚Äù segment below:

Here's the deleted trailer for the now-"delayed" segment. It's almost impressive how much damage Bari Weiss has done to CBS News in such a short period of time. 

Someone quickly schedule a prime-time Town Hall with Alan Dershowitz to rectify the harm:pic.twitter.com/382gRG5Lgp https://t.co/3gHRKNES2y

‚Äî Glenn Greenwald (@ggreenwald) December 21, 2025

The post ‚Äò60 Minutes‚Äô Abruptly Pulls Segment on Trump Deportees Sent to El Salvador Megaprison appeared first on TheWrap.

title: Analysis-China's power reforms, global data centre buildout usher in battery boom
description: A revamp of China's electricity market is boosting the economics of storing power just as international demand surges, sparking a boom for the Chinese energy storage manufacturers that already dominate globally.  Chinese firms are on track for a 75% jump this year in global shipments of lithium-ion battery cells for energy storage, ‚Äãaccording to one estimate.  They have exported more than $65 billion worth of storage and electric-vehicle batteries this year, cementing their dominance in a sector vital to backing up wind and solar ‚Äåand keeping power coursing through artificial-intelligence data centres.
fullText:
BEIJING, Dec 22 (Reuters) - A revamp of China's electricity market is boosting the economics of storing power just as international demand surges, sparking a boom for the Chinese energy storage manufacturers that already dominate globally.

Chinese firms are on track for a 75% jump this year in global shipments of lithium-ion battery cells for energy storage, ‚Äãaccording to one estimate.

They have exported more than $65 billion worth of storage and electric-vehicle batteries this year, cementing their dominance in a sector vital to backing up wind and solar ‚Äåand keeping power coursing through artificial-intelligence data centres.

The surge in sales is driven by data centres and renewables domestically, as well as by Chinese reforms and subsidies that are boosting general demand for energy storage. International demand is rising in tandem with the ‚Äåsurging growth in data centres, a need to back up Europe's ageing grid and China's burgeoning renewable energy business in the Middle East, analysts say.

"These leading energy storage cell makers, they have full orders. Many of them are basically working double shifts now to try and meet demand," said analyst Cosimo Ries at policy research firm Trivium China. The boom "is one of the biggest surprises of the year, I think, in China's energy space."

UBS last month raised its 2026 forecast for global battery-energy storage installations by 25%.

The International Energy Agency forecasts global investment in battery storage facilities will rise 16% this year to $66 billion. Much of that is ‚Å†set to be captured by Chinese firms because while Tesla is number ‚Äåone in energy storage systems, China dominates production of the tiny cells inside them.

All of the six top global cell suppliers - Contemporary Amperex Technology Ltd (CATL), HiTHIUM, EVE Energy, BYD, CALB and REPT BATTERO - are Chinese, according to a January-to-September ranking by consultancy Infolink. Of the top 10, only Japan's AESC is not from China.

EVE's ‚Äçenergy storage sales volumes rose 35.51% in the first three quarters from the same period last year. REPT BATTERO's third-quarter shipments of all batteries set a record high. Top EV players CATL and BYD did not break out energy storage shipments through the third quarter. Storage has historically made up less of their revenue than automotive batteries and EVs, although the proportion is growing.

"Pairing solar with storage has effectively become the only solution for meeting U.S. AI ‚Äãdata-centre power needs," UBS analyst Yishu Yan told a media briefing. "U.S. AI data centre power demand is very robust, but power is the biggest bottleneck, and U.S. baseload power - gas, nuclear, thermal - they ‚Äåwon't grow much in the next five years."

title: US says talks with Ukraine, Europe on ending war with Russia 'constructive'
description: A White House envoy said Sunday he held ‚Äúproductive and constructive‚Äù talks in Florida with Ukrainian and European representatives to end the nearly four-year war between Russia and Ukraine.  Posting on social media, Steve Witkoff said the talks aimed at aligning on a shared strategic approach between Ukraine, the United States and Europe.  Trump has unleashed an extensive diplomatic push to end the war, but his efforts have run into sharply conflicting demands by Moscow and Kyiv.
fullText:
A White House envoy said Sunday he held ‚Äúproductive and constructive‚Äù talks in Florida with Ukrainian and European representatives to end the nearly four-year war between Russia and Ukraine.

Posting on social media, Steve Witkoff said the talks aimed at aligning on a shared strategic approach between Ukraine, the United States and Europe.

‚ÄúOur shared priority is to stop the killing, ensure guaranteed security, and create conditions for Ukraine‚Äôs recovery, stability, and long-term prosperity. Peace must be not only a cessation of hostilities, but also a dignified foundation for a stable future," U.S. President Donald Trump's envoy said.

The talks are part of the Trump administration‚Äôs monthslong push for peace. Trump has unleashed an extensive diplomatic push to end the war, but his efforts have run into sharply conflicting demands by Moscow and Kyiv. Putin has recently signaled he is digging in on his maximalist demands on Ukraine, as Moscow‚Äôs troops inch forward on the battlefield despite huge losses.

Witkoff's assessment comes as negotiations have been proceeding with Russia as well. A Kremlin envoy said Saturday that the talks were pressing on ‚Äúconstructively‚Äù in Florida.

‚ÄúThe discussions are proceeding constructively. They began earlier and will continue today, and will also continue tomorrow,‚Äù Kirill Dmitriev told reporters in Miami on Saturday. There were no immediate updates on the talks with Russia on Sunday.

Dmitriev met with Witkoff and Trump‚Äôs son-in-law Jared Kushner, Russian state news agency RIA Novosti reported.

For Ukraine, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy wrote on Telegram Sunday that diplomatic efforts were ‚Äúmoving forward quite quickly, and our team in Florida has been working with the American side.‚Äù

The Kremlin denied Sunday that trilateral talks involving Ukraine, Russia and the U.S. were under discussion, after Zelenskyy said Saturday that Washington had proposed the idea of three-way discussions.

‚ÄúAt present, no one has seriously discussed this initiative, and to my knowledge it is not being prepared,‚Äù Russian President Vladimir Putin's foreign affairs adviser Yuri Ushakov said, according to Russian state news agencies.

Ukrainian civilians moved to Russia

In Ukraine, the country‚Äôs human rights ombudsman Dmytro Lubinets on Sunday accused Russian forces of forcibly removing about 50 Ukrainian civilians from the Ukrainian Sumy border region to Russian territory.

Writing on Telegram, he said that Russian forces illegally detained the residents in the village of Hrabovske on Thursday, before moving them to Russia on Saturday.

Lubinets said he contacted Russia‚Äôs human rights commissioner, requesting information on the civilians‚Äô whereabouts and conditions, and demanding their immediate return to Ukraine.

The French presidency on Sunday welcomed Putin‚Äôs willingness to speak with President Emmanuel Macron, saying it would decide how to proceed ‚Äúin the coming days.‚Äù

‚ÄúAs soon as the prospect of a ceasefire and peace negotiations becomes clearer, it becomes useful again to speak with Putin,‚Äù Macron‚Äôs office said in a statement. ‚ÄúIt is welcome that the Kremlin publicly agrees to this approach.‚Äù

The statement came after reports that Putin was open to holding talks with the French president if there was mutual political will.

European Union leaders agreed on Friday to provide 90 billion euros ($106 billion) to Ukraine to meet its military and economic needs for the next two years, although they failed to bridge differences with Belgium that would have allowed them to use frozen Russian assets to raise the funds. Instead, they were borrowed from capital markets.

Trump, 79, Called Out for Awkward Exit on Air Force One‚Äôs Steps
description: Donald Trump has fueled new speculation about his health after an awkward descent on Air Force One‚Äôs stairs. A video of the 79-year-old president exiting the plane at Palm Beach International Airport on Saturday morning, posted by MAGA influencer Paul Villarreal, has drawn attention online for Trump‚Äôs odd hand movement and slow, careful descent. In the video, Trump appears at the aircraft door and slaps his right leg three times with his right hand before heading down the stairs. He cautiously n
fullText:
Donald Trump has fueled new speculation about his health after an awkward descent on Air Force One‚Äôs stairs.

A video of the 79-year-old president exiting the plane at Palm Beach International Airport on Saturday morning, posted by MAGA influencer Paul Villarreal, has drawn attention online for Trump‚Äôs odd hand movement and slow, careful descent.

In the video, Trump appears at the aircraft door and slaps his right leg three times with his right hand before heading down the stairs. He cautiously navigates the steps while gripping tightly onto the railing, taking about 18 seconds to reach the bottom of the short staircase.

President Trump exited Air Force One tonight in West Palm Beach. He is headed to Mar-a-Lago.
. pic.twitter.com/Z4vBY8qobw

‚Äî Paul Villarreal (AKA Vince Manfeld) (@AureliusStoic1) December 20, 2025

He then plops into ‚ÄúThe Beast,‚Äù the heavily armored presidential car, where he is seen drinking what appears to be a Diet Coke. Trump is spending Christmas at his Mar-a-Lago estate.

Critics online were quick to note the president‚Äôs apparent frailty and peculiar leg-slapping.

‚ÄúTapping that leg to make sure it works going down,‚Äù one X user commented.

Another wrote, ‚ÄúI wish he concentrated on the economy like he concentrated on going down those stairs.‚Äù

One person hypothesized about his hand motions, ‚ÄúIt is not his leg he is touching, but he is trying to get life back into his hand.‚Äù

The elderly president‚Äôs supporters defended him, however, with many pointing out that Trump had just wrapped up a long day, including a rally in Rocky Mount, North Carolina.

Trump‚Äîwho was filmed stumbling on Air Force One‚Äôs stairs during a visit to New Jersey in June this year‚Äîhas frequently spoken about being ‚Äúvery careful‚Äù about walking down stairs to avoid the perils of his predecessor, Joe Biden.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm very careful. You know, when I walk downstairs‚Äîlike I‚Äôm on stairs like these stairs‚ÄîI walk very slowly,‚Äú Trump said while addressing the nation‚Äôs top generals in September.

A few days later, he brought up the subject again while taking shots at Biden during a speech to Navy sailors.

‚ÄúWe had a horrible, horrible president who had no clue what the hell was happening. The chances of him walking down those stairs successfully were not good,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAnd I have to be careful because one day I‚Äôm gonna probably fall.‚Äù

The commander-in-chief then revealed what he apparently tells himself while walking down stairs: ‚ÄúI always say, ‚ÄòWalk down the steps nice and slowly.‚Äô You ever notice? I don‚Äôt have to bop down the stairs. ‚ÄòWalk nice and slowly.‚Äô‚Äù

Questions around Trump‚Äôs health have dogged him in his second term, particularly after he let slip that he had undergone an MRI scan in October.

The White House eventually said it was a ‚Äúpreventative‚Äù look at his heart and abdomen, a claim met with skepticism from medical experts who stressed that there was ‚Äúnothing standard‚Äù about the scan.

The Daily Beast has reached out to the White House for comment.

title: Jyske Bank repurchases shares worth DKK 62.9 million in week 51
description: Jyske Bank repurchases shares worth DKK 62.9 million in week 51
fullText:
COPENHAGEN - Jyske Bank has acquired shares worth approximately DKK 62.9 million during week 51 of 2025 as part of its ongoing share repurchase program, according to a press release statement from the Danish bank.

The transactions, conducted between December 15 and December 19, involved the purchase of 74,963 shares at prices ranging from DKK 830.06 to DKK 856.17 per share.

Following these transactions, Jyske Bank now holds 2,986,009 treasury shares, representing 4.85% of its total share capital. This figure excludes investments made on behalf of customers and shares held for trading purposes.

The current share repurchase program, which began on February 26, 2025, will continue until January 30, 2026. During this period, the bank aims to acquire shares with a total value of up to DKK 2.25 billion.

Since the program‚Äôs inception, Jyske Bank has accumulated shares worth approximately DKK 1.96 billion, representing about 87% of the total planned repurchase amount.

The bank stated that the repurchase program has been structured in compliance with the EU Commission Regulation No. 596/2014 (Market Abuse Regulation) and the Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2016/1052, collectively known as the "Safe Harbour Rules."

The share repurchase program was initially announced in Corporate Announcement No. 3/2025 released on February 26, 2025.

This article was generated with the support of AI and reviewed by an editor.

Powerball ticket worth $2.3 million sold in California
description: A Powerball ticket worth $2.3 million was sold in California. This comes as no one got the winning ticket for the $1.5 billion jackpot.
fullText:
A Powerball ticket worth $2.3 million was sold in California.

This comes as no one got the winning ticket for the $1.5 billion jackpot.

The following were the winning numbers from the Saturday, Dec. 20 drawing: 4, 5, 28, 52, 69. PB: 20.

Sad about not winning the billion-dollar Powerball jackpot? Don't throw away your tickets just yet.

More than 400 Powerball tickets worth more than $400 were sold across California over the weekend, with the highest "consolation prize" ticket going for more than $2.3 million.

According to California Lottery's website on Saturday night, a ticket worth $2,323,527 was sold at Wright's Market on Ventura Boulevard in Oxnard.

This comes as a drawing was held for the then-jackpot of $1.5 billion. Below were the winning numbers for the Dec. 20 drawing ‚Äì which apparently no one got all six numbers:

The drawing for the new jackpot of $1.6 billion will be held on Monday, December 22 at 8 p.m. PT.

There are 400 millions of reasons to dream, especially what you would do with the jackpot money. However, one thing all lottery winners have to take into account is the fact that their prizes will be taxed.

So how much do you really get after taxes?

It depends on a couple of factors: do you have to pay state taxes where you live? Will you take the lump sum payment or the annuity payout?

According to Mega Millions' website, those electing to take the annuity option get one immediate payment followed by 29 annual payments. Powerball follows an identical process for paying out its jackpot winners.

This story was reported from Los Angeles.

This report used information provided by the California Lottery website and mentioned previous FOX 11 reports.

title: Trump announces he's appointing Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry to serve as US special envoy to Greenland
description: President Donald Trump ‚Äçon Sunday ‚Äãannounced ‚Äãhe ‚Å†is appointing Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry to serve as the U.S. ‚Äåspecial envoy to Greenland, the vast, semi-autonomous territory of Denmark that Trump has said the U.S.
fullText:
WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) ‚Äî President Donald Trump ‚Äçon Sunday ‚Äãannounced ‚Äãhe ‚Å†is appointing Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry to serve as the U.S. ‚Äåspecial envoy to Greenland, the vast, semi-autonomous territory of Denmark that Trump has said the U.S. needs to take over.

‚ÄúJeff understands how essential Greenland is to our National Security, and will strongly advance our Country‚Äôs Interests for the Safety, Security, and Survival of our Allies, and indeed, the World,‚Äù Trump said in announcing the appointment.

Trump during his presidential transition and in the early months of his return to the White House repeatedly called for U.S. jurisdiction over Greenland, and has not ruled out military force to take control of the mineral-rich, strategically located Arctic island.

The issue had drifted out of the headlines in recent months, but in August, Danish officials summoned the U.S. ambassador following a report that at least three people with connections to Trump had carried out covert influence operations in Greenland.

Earlier this year, Vice President JD Vance visited a remote U.S. military base on the island and accused Denmark of underinvesting there.

Trump has said that Greenland is crucial for U.S. security and hasn‚Äôt ruled out taking the island by military force, even though Denmark is a NATO ally of the U.S.

Landry took office as governor in January 2024. His term ends in January 2028.

‚ÄúIt's an honor to serve you in this volunteer position to make Greenland a part of the U.S.,‚Äù Landry wrote in a posting on X in which he thanked Trump for the appointment. He added, "This in no way affects my position as Governor of Louisiana!‚Äù

Denmark, a NATO ally of the U.S., and Greenland have said the island is not for sale and condemned reports of the U.S. gathering intelligence there. The U.S. push for Greenland is also opposed by Russia and much of Europe.

The Embassy of Denmark in Washington did not immediately respond to requests for comment about Landry's appointment.

The Danish Defense Intelligence Service said in a report earlier this month that the United States is using its economic power to ‚Äúassert its will‚Äù and threaten military force against friend and foe alike.

The service, in its annual assessment, said Washington‚Äôs greater assertiveness under the Trump administration also comes as China and Russia seek to diminish Western, especially American, influence.

"The strategic importance of the Arctic is rising as the conflict between Russia and the West intensifies, and the growing security and strategic focus on the Arctic by the United States will further accelerate these developments,‚Äù the report said.

title: 'We've all grown up with radiators - underfloor heating is a no-brainer'
description: The story behind Wales-based Wunda Group, which designs and supplies energy-efficient underfloor heating systems.
fullText:
When entrepreneurs Charles and Josephine Pugh rented a property with "uncomfortable and uncontrollable" underfloor heating (UFH), it sparked a move away from the made-to-order furniture world they had been invested in since the late 1970s.

The couple, who had founded British retailer Multiyork in 1978, set up Wunda Group in 2006 at the height of the 'green homes revolution' when barn conversions and self-builds were de rigueur.

The Pughs‚Äô home heating issue had centred on underfloor screed ‚Äî a level layer of concrete where piping has traditionally been embedded into ‚Äî with pipe centres too far apart. With no controls, there was a slow response time to heat and the floor became too hot. The Pughs thought the existing systems were "slow and antiquated".

Monmouthshire-based Wunda now designs and supplies energy-efficient UFH systems and has cut through to the DIY consumer at a time of rising energy bills. The company employs 90 staff and says it has booked over ¬£10m in sales this year.

The heating firm is also a family affair. With Charles as CEO and Josephine CFO, their daughter Josephine is managing director, while grandson Sam Jump is currently head of business development.

The business took off in 2008 when Wunda reorientated as installers looked for kits and components after the self-build market collapsed.

In 2010, their former base near Chepstow was in an old chicken farm shed renovated to offices. The Pughs still visited trade shows and had come across one American exhibitor‚Äôs aluminum chip board panel with grooves, which was employed as a last fix in the build.

They pioneered a version with high-compressed polystyrene and put a sample down in the chicken shed, with a heat pump which moved outside thermal energy internally. The closer piping also meant it could be run at lower temperatures.

Jump, who was working in the warehouse at the time and previously led a team of outreachers offering membership, recalled: ‚ÄúEveryone was walking around in T-shirts during winter and the response rate was unreal, the heat pump was operating at the optimum flow temperature with a co-efficient performance.‚Äù

However, their product was initially met with scepticism from installers unwilling to test new products. ‚ÄúWhere most people think of UFH as this uncomfortable system, we now have a rapid response system and it warms up as fast as radiators, if not quicker.‚Äù

A booming DIY industry, renovating homes or building extensions instead of moving, has helped boost Wunda‚Äôs profits.

title: Burry‚Äôs Massive Puts vs. a Street‚ÄëHigh $255 Target From Bank of America ‚Äì Who Should You Follow?
description: Michael Burry has been butting heads with the bulls on Wall Street, specifically regarding Palantir (NASDAQ:PLTR). The bulls have won big so far, and the price targets have gotten even bolder. On the other hand, most analysts are sitting on the fence with a ‚ÄúHold‚Äù rating, with three analysts having ‚ÄúSell‚Äù ratings on the stock. ... Burry‚Äôs Massive Puts vs.
fullText:
Palantir (PLTR) trades at 552 times trailing earnings and 175 times forward earnings. Bank of America set a $255 price target.

Michael Burry bought $9.2 million in Palantir put options at a $50 strike price expiring in 2027.

Palantir maintains a 50% free cash flow margin with full-year FCF estimated at $2.1 billion.

If you‚Äôre thinking about retiring or know someone who is, there are three quick questions causing many Americans to realize they can retire earlier than expected. take 5 minutes to learn more here

Michael Burry has been butting heads with the bulls on Wall Street, specifically regarding Palantir (NASDAQ:PLTR). The bulls have won big so far, and the price targets have gotten even bolder. On the other hand, most analysts are sitting on the fence with a "Hold" rating, with three analysts having "Sell" ratings on the stock. There are four "Strong Buy" ratings, with the highest price target at $255, from Bank of America (NYSE:BAC).

Burry believes PLTR stock may be on the cusp of an implosion, with his bearish thesis focusing on the sky-high valuation of the stock. PLTR stock trades at 156 times trailing sales and at 552 times trailing earnings. It still trades at 175 times next year's expected earnings, which is an unprecedented valuation that no other big tech stock has seen since the Dot Com era.

This may be old news by now, but it's worth a refresher before we get to the meat.

Burry holds put options on approximately 5 million Palantir shares, with a notional value of around $912 million. This is the largest bearish bet in his portfolio and constitutes 66% of his reported holdings. The true amount involved is much lower. Burry himself posted on X, saying that he spent $9.2 million buying 50,000 put options on Palantir.

These options expire in 2027 at a strike price of $50. Burry is betting that PLTR stock will decline well below $50, allowing him to sell higher at the strike price when it expires.

Regardless, this is a drop in the bucket compared to how much Burry's spending power. The notional value did lead to dramatic headlines and lured in comments from Palantir CEO Alex Karp, who called Burry "batshit crazy" during an interview.

The bulls' argument is essentially that Palantir is an extraordinary company that deserves an extraordinary valuation. It has managed to grow significantly after getting its foot in the door at any company/agency. What truly makes this growth special is that the company has a free cash flow margin of nearly 50%. For a company believed to be early on in its growth cycle, Palantir is truly exceptional.

title: Texans playoff picture: Updated chances for Houston to make 2025 NFL postseason after Week 16 win over Raiders
description: The Texans are moving closer to a playoff return.
fullText:
Texans playoff picture: Updated chances for Houston to make 2025 NFL postseason after Week 16 win over Raiders originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Houston Texans don't always make it look pretty, but that's par for the course for a team driven by its defense.

After falling behind in the second half of Sunday's game against the Las Vegas Raiders, the Texans held on and won for the 10th time in their last 12 games after starting the season 0-3.

A seven-game win streak has the Texans dreaming of a deep playoff run, but have they clinched their spot in the postseason yet?

Here's what you need to know about the Texans' playoff chances and how they can punch their ticket.

How Travis Kelce's retirement decision is easy with no Patrick Mahomes

Panthers take control of NFC South with massive win over Buccaneers

Myles Garrett inches closer to NFL sack record with obscure half sack

Gardner Minshew suffers potential ACL tear in first Chiefs game without Patrick Mahomes

Quinshon Judkins out for season after gruesome leg injury vs. Bills

The Texans couldn't catch the Jacksonville Jaguars in the AFC South on Sunday with Jacksonville winning in Denver, but Houston's win ensures the race will remain a tight one entering the final two weeks of the season.

The Indianapolis Colts would be eliminated from AFC South contention with a loss to the San Francisco 49ers on Monday.

The Texans cannot clinch a playoff berth in Week 16, but the victory did bring them one major step closer to punching their ticket.

A Colts loss on Monday would make Houston's path to clinching in Week 17 much simpler, but the Texans are in control of their fate when it comes to getting into the playoffs.

Elsewhere, Sunday's results were not ideal for the Texans. Houston missed an opportunity to jump higher than the No. 7 seed because the Los Angeles Chargers and Buffalo Bills both won and the Jaguars maintained their lead in the AFC South.

Watch DK Metcalf throw punch at Lions fan on sidelines

Kenneth Gainwell makes circus catch for potential coach of the year

The Texans have a tough test against the Chargers in Week 17, going out to the West Coast to play a critical Saturday game against a likely playoff team.

Houston closes its season against the Colts, though it's unclear whether Indianapolis will still be in playoff contention by Week 18.

title: Patriots game day roster: NFL Week 16 vs. Ravens
description: A look at the Patriots‚Äô game day roster for their Week 16 game on Sunday night.
fullText:
With Robert Spillane sidelined throughout the game, the New England Patriots‚Äô linebacker group had a disappointing outing last week versus the Buffalo Bills. The challenge will not be any easier for the position on Sunday night against the Baltimore Ravens.

Not only will Spillane miss a second straight game because of an ankle injury, the Ravens feature one of the best run games in the NFL. Led by the two-headed monster of quarterback Lamar Jackson and running back Derrick Henry, they are entering Sunday as the league leaders in yards per carry (5.2).

With Spillane out, that means the task on stopping this potent an attack will fall on replacement starting duo Jack Gibbens and Christian Elliss. As head coach Mike Vrabel pointed out on Friday, however, they will not be the only one in the spotlight.

‚ÄúEverybody that goes to the game is going to play and have a role, and we ask everybody to prepare as starters,‚Äù Vrabel explained. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs something that‚Äôs important. And so, Gibby will start in there, and then different guys will play, packages and everything else.‚Äù

New England‚Äôs full game day roster against the Ravens looks as follows:

title: Trevor Lawrence, Jaguars steamroll Denver defense to snap 11-game Broncos win streak, put No. 1 seed in AFC up for grabs
description: If you weren't counting the Jaguars among Super Bowl contenders before, it's time to reconsider that stance.
fullText:
The Denver Broncos rolled into Week 16 against the Jacksonville Jaguars riding an 11-game win streak with visions of clinching the No. 1 seed in the AFC playoffs.

The Jaguars had other ideas. Sparked by another big game from quarterback Trevor Lawrence, the Jaguars steamrolled the vaunted Broncos' defense in Denver to secure a 34-20 win.

With the win, the Jaguars improve to 11-4 while turning the race for the No. 1 seed in the AFC into a five-team contest. The Broncos drop to 12-3, while the 11-4 Chargers, 11-4 Bills and 11-3 Patriots (ahead of Sunday night's game against the Ravens) all remain in the race for the first-round bye in the AFC playoff bracket.

Lawrence led the way while completing 23 of 36 passes for for 279 yards with 3 touchdowns and no interceptions. He added 20 yards and a fourth touchdown on the ground.

This, a week after Lawrence led a 48-20 romp over the Jets with 330 passing yards, 5 touchdowns and no turnovers. But that was against the Jets.

Sunday was against a Super Bowl-contending Broncos team with one of the best defenses in football. And if you weren't counting the Jaguars among Super Bowl contenders before, it's time to reconsider that stance.

The early portion of Sunday's contest was a back-and-forth affair that saw the Broncos tie the game at 17-17 early in the third quarter. But the tenor of the game took a dramatic shift on Jacksonville's first possession of the second half.

Sparked by a pair of big penalties, the Jaguars drove 75 yards for a touchdown. A roughing the passing penalty for bodyweight on a hit of Lawrence on first down moved the Jaguars across midfield and riled up the raucous Denver crowd.

Then in the red zone on second down, the Broncos got flagged for pass interference in the end zone when Jahdae Barron grabbed Parker Washington's arm while the ball was in the air. This brought the home crowd into a frenzy.

Lawrence responded by running untouched into the end zone for 24-17 lead Jaguars lead.

Back and forth we goooo@trevorlawrence | #JAXvsDEN on FOXpic.twitter.com/ySt0CgOLMW

‚Äî Jacksonville Jaguars (@Jaguars) December 21, 2025

The Broncos had multiple chances to answer, but there was no Bo Nix magic in the second half this time.

Denver punted after four plays on its ensuing possession. Following another Jaguars touchdown for a 31-17 lead, a botched handoff from Nix to Jaleel McLaughlin resulted in Denver's first turnover of the game. The Jaguars converted that fumble into a field goal for a 34-17 lead.

Then with 8:08 remaining, Nix forced a sideline pass to Pat Bryant in tight coverage. Jarrian Jones was there for the interception to all but ice the Jacksonville win.

Bo Nix is intercepted by Jarrian Jones üëÄ

üì∫ FOX pic.twitter.com/4pNMf0lkHU

‚Äî FOX Sports: NFL (@NFLonFOX) December 21, 2025

For the day, Nix completed 28 of 47 passes for 352 yards with 1 touchdown and 1 interception. He was credited with a lost fumble on the botched handoff in the third quarter. And the Jaguars finished the game with a 2-0 advantage in takeaways. Those turnovers ultimately tanked any hope of a Broncos comeback.

Even with the loss, the Broncos maintain control of that No. 1 seed. Their 12-3 record remains alone atop the AFC. And they hold the tiebreaker over the Patriots if the Patriots win Sunday night.

But with two weeks remaining in the season, the race for that No. 1 seed is anything but settled. And the Chargers could still win the AFC West. The Broncos and Chargers will face off in Week 18, when the division title could be at stake.

title: Broncos WR Pat Bryant carted off field vs. Jaguars
description: Prayers up for Broncos WR Pat Bryant, who was carted off the field on Sunday.
fullText:
Denver Broncos wide receiver Pat Bryant was carted off the field after taking a hard hit from Jacksonville Jaguars cornerback Montaric Brown on one of the final plays of Sunday's game at Empower Field at Mile High.

Brown was initially penalized for the hit, but officials picked up the flag after the cornerback was deemed to have hit Bryant in the chest, not in the head. Players for both teams gathered around Bryant while he was on the ground. Denver quarterback Bo Nix slammed his helmet on the ground after the play.

Bryant was placed on a backboard and carted to the locker room with 31 seconds remaining. Nix then threw a short pass to running back Tyler Badie, who went down after two yards, sealing a 34-20 loss for the Broncos.

Bryant had five catches for 42 yards before suffering the injury. The third-round pick out of Illinois had totaled 22 receptions for 305 yards and one score going into the game.

This article originally appeared on Broncos Wire: NFL news: Broncos WR Pat Bryant carted off field vs. Jaguars

title: Sergio Vega, Oklahoma State wrestling top Nebraska for second time
description: No. 5-ranked Oklahoma State topped No. 6-ranked Nebraska 22-12 in a wrestling dual Sunday afternoon at the Devaney Center in Lincoln, Nebraska.
fullText:
No. 5-ranked Oklahoma State topped No. 6-ranked Nebraska 22-12 in a wrestling dual Sunday afternoon at the Devaney Center in Lincoln, Nebraska, taking six of the 10 bouts.

OSU (8-1) has topped Nebraska (6-3) twice this season, including the third-place match at the National Duals Invitational in Tulsa.

The Cowboys also now have five ranked wins this season, including three over top-10 teams.

On Sunday, true freshman Sergio Vega picked up huge bonus points with a first-period pin of three-time All-American Brock Hardy in the 141-pound match. It was the first time Hardy had been pinned in his career. Vega now has four top-10 wins in just eight collegiate bouts.

More: Konner Doucet vs AJ Ferrari tops key matchups in Oklahoma State-Nebraska wrestling dual

OSU's Troy Spratley opened the match with major decision.

The Cowboys clinched the victory in the 197-pound match. Holding a 16-12 lead, Cody Merrill rode out Camden McDanel in the third for a 2-1 win. It was Merrill's second win over McDanel.

Former Cowboy AJ Ferrari, now a heavyweight with the Huskers, did not wrestle for a third straight dual.

OSU is off until Jan. 3, when it travels to Chattanooga, Tennessee, for the Southern Scuffle. The Pokes' next dual is a home Bedlam bout with OU on Jan. 11.

This article originally appeared on Oklahoman: Sergio Vega, Oklahoma State wrestling top Nebraska in top-10 dual

title: Knights in the NBA: Two Budding Stars
description: Bailey, Harper starting to make their mark in the NBA.
fullText:
We are three months into the NBA season, and the two former superstars for Rutgers men‚Äôs basketball are proving why they were drafted high and are showing potential to dominate the league for years to come.

Ace Bailey, despite a slower start to the season, is playing his best basketball as of late. Bailey started the year by averaging 4.4 points per game in October. However, in the two months since then, Bailey has averaged 12.1 points in November and 11.5 points in December. He has already had three 20-point games and has all but three games in double-digit points in December. He has recorded several highlight-worthy shots, including the one below.

Bailey still has a lot of development to do to reach his maximum potential in the NBA. If his time so far is any indication, he is on an upward trajectory to reach that level. He was viewed as an all-around project when he was drafted by the Jazz. In particular, his field goal shooting percentage, defense, and rebounding still need a lot of work. Regardless, he has looked better and better with each passing game.

HERE COMES ACE BAILEY ‚ÄºÔ∏è

THE ROOK JUST ROCKED THE RIM IN UTAH.

Tap to watch: https://t.co/nnbneYnnKu pic.twitter.com/2bnTNCCWqB

Arguably, the more NBA-ready of the two when they declared for the draft, Dylan Harper has already demonstrated an ability to take over games, despite playing in the NBA for less than three whole months. Against Washington earlier in the month, Harper recorded 24 points and five rebounds in San Antonio‚Äôs dominating 119-94 win over the Wizards. This is not the first time this season he has recorded a similar stat line, as he has recorded games with 20 or more points and six or more rebounds two other times.

Harper is averaging 48.2 percent on field goals, which is just above the average for NBA players, which has been 46.9 percent this season. However, this three-point percentage needs some work, as he is averaging 30.2 percent per game this season when the league average for three-point percentage per game is 35.8 percent.

Dylan Harper 24 Points, 5 Rebs, 3 Assists full highlight vs Wizards I 25-26 NBA Season pic.twitter.com/XfqF8sWvYR

‚Äî Hoops Showtime (@HoopsShowtime12) December 19, 2025

Both have shown their ability to score so far in this league. Now they need to prove that they can be contributors in the other statistics. Those will likely start to click as they get more experience on an NBA court.

Ron Harper Jr. has spent most of his time this season on the Boston Celtics G League squad, the Maine Celtics. However, he has been called up to the main roster a few times, where he was largely used as a rotational piece due to injuries. Harper has seen action in four NBA games this season, seeing 20 minutes on the floor across all four. He has 8 points so far this season, with six of them coming in the Celtics game against the Memphis Grizzlies. He has three rebounds on the year as well, all of which came against Houston.

title: Blue Jays CEO Shares Bold Take On Red Sox‚Äôs Future
description: Toronto Blue Jays President and CEO Mark Shapiro believes the Boston Red Sox could be the team to beat. The Red Sox made the playoffs last season and have been active this offseason, adding the likes of Sonny Gray and Johan Oviedo to round out their pitching staff. Yet, Boston is still led by a [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Toronto Blue Jays President and CEO Mark Shapiro believes the Boston Red Sox could be the team to beat.

The Red Sox made the playoffs last season and have been active this offseason, adding the likes of Sonny Gray and Johan Oviedo to round out their pitching staff.

Yet, Boston is still led by a young core that features the likes of Roman Anthony, Marcelo Mayer, and Cedanne Rafaela, while Garrett Crochet is the team‚Äôs ace. With that, Shapiro believes no team is better set up for the next five years than the Red Sox.

‚ÄúBoston is probably positioned as well as any team in all of Major League Baseball,‚Äù Shapiro said on MLB Network Radio on Sunday. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if there is a team that is positioned for the next five years better than the Boston Red Sox with young talent and flexibility.‚Äù

It‚Äôs a bold take from the Blue Jays CEO, as the Red Sox are a division rival of Toronto, but Shapiro clearly likes what he sees from Boston.

With Shapiro expecting the Red Sox to be better, he knows the AL East will be a tough division to win this year.

‚ÄúWe already knew Baltimore was going to be better than they were last year,‚Äù Shapiro added. ‚ÄúAll you have to do is look at them in the second half. They clearly have gotten better with Taylor Ward, with Shane Baz, and others.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôve had a good offseason, and I don‚Äôt think they are done. The Yankees are clearly, you know, they are not done. Tampa is going to be better; they are never bad, they are going to be better.‚Äù

Although Shapiro believes everyone in the AL East will be better, his comments about the Red Sox stand out.

Red Sox Reportedly Swing Huge Trade For Three-Time All-Star

title: Instant reaction: Broncos‚Äô defense fizzles out as Jaguars route Denver 34-20
description: The Denver Broncos had their 11-game winning streak come to an end with their 34-20 loss to the Jacksonville Jaguars.
fullText:
The Denver Broncos hosted the roaring Jacksonville Jaguars in their Week 16 matchup. A gridiron battle of two division leaders, this one was expected to be a close and hard-fought matchup. It turned out to be the opposite, with the Jaguars throttling the Broncos 34-20 and ending their 11-game winning streak. Here are some instant reactions and key takeaways from today‚Äôs game.

Penalties, drops, and miscues plague Broncos‚Äô offensive effort

Last week against the Green Bay Packers, Bo Nix and the offense had one of their most complete games of the season. In order to defeat the Jaguars, they needed to replicate some of that success. Sadly, that was far from the case with only several good drives through sixty minutes of play.

After struggling in the first quarter, they were able muster a quality scoring drive early on in the second quarter. A 15-yard fade to Courtland Sutton tied the game up. A few drives later, Wil Lutz was able to connect on a 54-yard field goal to give the Broncos a 10-7 lead‚Äîbut that was short-lived with Denver being down 17-10 at halftime.

Denver‚Äôs first drive of the second half couldn‚Äôt have gone any better. Rookie running back RJ Harvey broke a few tackles and dove for the pylon to cap off a 38-yard touchdown scamper that tied the game up at 17. It was an absolutely marvelous play by the second-round pick. After that? There wasn‚Äôt much to write home about.

Three-and-outs and stalled drives were a theme for the Broncos thereafter. A failed handoff exchange between Nix and Jaleel McLaughlin late in the third quarter was the straw that broke the camel‚Äôs back with Denver already down 31-17. In the fourth quarter down 34-20, Nix threw an interception on fourth down that officially ended any hopes of a miracle comeback.

Penalties, drops, turnovers, and miscues all played a culprit in the Broncos‚Äô regression on offense against the Jaguars. Ther only bright spot on offense was Harvey‚Äôs performance. It was in a losing effort, but over 120 all-purpose yards and a touchdown is praiseworthy. The team will continue to need him to play at a high level in the final weeks of the season to help secure the division title and top seed in the AFC.

Jarrian Jones picks off Nix!

JAXvsDEN on FOX/FOX Onehttps://t.co/HkKw7uXnxV pic.twitter.com/F9MjGz2RRZ

Defense fails to show up in worst performance of the season

The Jaguars entered today‚Äôs contest averaging well over 30 points a game since their bye week. Both Trevor Lawrence and Travis Etienne were on hot streaks. It was a big task for the Broncos to slow them down. Unfortunately, they struggled all game long and had their worst performance of the year. It was ugly throughout four quarters.

One area of concern I had was how safety P.J. Locke would hold up in coverage. He surrendered a touchdown reception to tight end Brenton Strange in the second quarter‚Äîaided by a clear push off by Strange. However, he was also targeted often on the Jaguars‚Äô scoring drive right before halftime and also in the second half. It‚Äôs clear that Brandon Jones‚Äô presence in the backend of Denver‚Äôs secondary was sorely missed.

On top of that, Lawrence was able to light up the Broncos‚Äô red zone defense. Entering today‚Äôs game, Denver‚Äôs red zone defense was best in the NFL in ‚Äò25 and a huge strength. Today? They gave up four touchdowns in Jacksonville‚Äôs first four trips inside the 20. That‚Äôs certainly not a recipe for success. It was Murphy‚Äôs Law for the Broncos on defense this afternoon.

Missed tackles, missed coverage assignments, and penalties hampered Denver‚Äôs ability to thwart Jacksonville‚Äôs offensive endeavors. The Jaguars were routinely able to create yards after the catch and blow past Broncos defenders. It‚Äôs been a long time since we have seen them play this poorly. But perhaps a wakeup call was eventually in order. It‚Äôs really not worth mentioning ‚Äòelite‚Äô and this defense in the same sentence any longer.

After multiple weeks of showing concerning weaknesses, all of the Broncos‚Äô biggest flaws were exposed today. With only two games remaining before the playoffs, the team doesn‚Äôt have long to correct them. If they can‚Äôt, their hopes of a strong postseason push may be in jeopardy. Defensive Coordinator Vance Joseph and his players have their work cut out for them.

This Bronco Defense is all kinds of out of sorts. 

Busting coverages, not setting edges, no QB player on obvious Zone Read situations. 

Trevor Lawrence & Liam Cohen continue to punch the bruise. 

The Brandon Jones loss looms larger than I would have expected.

‚Äî Coach Mike Sanford (@Coach_Sanford2) December 21, 2025

Denver can‚Äôt let this loss linger. Recalibrate and beat the Chiefs on Christmas.

All good things come to an end. It‚Äôs been an awesome season for the Broncos, but their eleven-game winning streak is now over. Getting pummeled at home by the Jaguars wasn‚Äôt on the radar for me. I thought the Broncos would win in a close game.

A huge credit to Jacksonville for being the better team today. They executed a great gameplan on both sides of the ball. They also delivered Denver their first loss at home since October of last season. That‚Äôs pretty wild when you think about it.

That being said, the Broncos can‚Äôt afford to dwell on this loss and let it linger. They need to shift gears quickly and be prepared to defeat the Kansas City Chiefs at Arrowhead Stadium on Christmas. There usually isn‚Äôt a good way to spin a loss, but this sort of adversity might be important for the Broncos to experience before the postseason hits.

It can serve as a bit of a reality check for them. Moreover, it‚Äôs certainly a woeful performance where there will be ample tape to show what they need to correct and improve upon. The next two games are against division rivals. They are must-win games for Denver to win the AFC West and find a way to edge out the competition for that coveted first-round bye and homefield advantage that comes with the #1 seed.

Will the Broncos be able to show some tenacity and resiliency over the next two weeks? I sure hope so. So much is at stake. Let‚Äôs hope they can finish off the season strong with back-to-back wins. Although it isn‚Äôt going to be easy, especially with Pat Bryant and Dre Greenlaw being injured late in today‚Äôs game.

Probably a good time to note that the Broncos can lose today and still get the No. 1 seed with 2 wins.

And also that every time they've won the SB they've had back-to-back December losses. (Not saying you want that here, because that means losing to a KC team w/ its No. 3 QB)

‚Äî Andrew Mason (@MaseDenver) December 21, 2025

title: Texans survive with 23-21 win over Raiders
description: The Texans were expected to beat the Raiders easily.
fullText:
The Texans were expected to beat the Raiders easily. Houston did win, but it wasn't easy.

In a surprisingly competitive game, the Raiders took a second-half lead and the Texans needed to come back and then hold on in the fourth quarter to survive with a 23-21 win.

Texans quarterback CJ Stroud completed 23 of 35 passes for 187 yards, with a touchdown and no interceptions. Raiders quarterback Geno Smith completed 16 of 23 passes for 201 yards, with two touchdowns and one interception.

The star of the game for the Raiders was rookie running back Ashton Jeanty, who had 24 carries for 128 yards and a touchdown, and added a 60-yard receiving touchdown. In an up-and-down rookie season, Jeanty showed everything the Raiders wanted to see from him today.

But it wasn't enough, and the Texans won to improve to 10-5 and stay in contention for both the AFC South and a wild card berth. The loss drops the Raiders to 2-13 and keeps them in contention for the first overall pick in the 2026 NFL draft.

title: Brutal QB luck continues for Chiefs with Gardner Minshew injury
description: Things went from bad to worse for the Kansas City Chiefs at the quarterback position on Sunday against the Tennessee Titans.
fullText:
Things went from bad to worse for the Kansas City Chiefs at the quarterback position on Sunday against the Tennessee Titans.

The Chiefs had already taken a major blow as they lost starting quarterback and multi-time Super Bowl Champion Patrick Mahomes last week to a torn ACL in a loss to the Chargers that eliminated the team from playoff contention for the first time in over a decade. But just when Chiefs fans thought the tough times couldn't get much tougher, that is exactly what happened as backup quarterback Gardner Minshew left the game against the Titans due to injury.

The real kicker? Early reports indicate that Minshew also tore his ACL, becoming the second quarterback for the Chiefs to do so in two weeks ‚Äì and forcing Kansas City into a position where they will have to finish their last two games without their top two quarterbacks.

Chiefs are concerned that QB Gardner Minshew tore his ACL, as @mattderrick also reported. There will be additional tests but Minshew could be the second Chiefs‚Äô quarterback in two games to tear his ACL. pic.twitter.com/vDVoxOTGKb

‚Äî Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) December 21, 2025

To add insult to (literal) injury, the Chiefs would end up losing the game to the Titans 26-9, handing Tennessee just their third win of the season in the process. Kansas City dropped to 6-9 overall with the loss, further worsening an already disappointing season for the Chiefs which still features an upcoming game with the AFC West leader and potential top AFC playoff seed the Denver Broncos.

The Chiefs will now turn to third-string quarterback Chris Oladokun, who starred in college at South Florida, Samford, and South Dakota State before being drafted in the seventh round of the 2022 NFL Draft by the Steelers before eventually landing in Kansas City.

He entered Sunday's loss to the Chiefs following the injury to Minshew, and completed his first career pass on a touchdown to Travis Kelce. He would finish the game 11-of-16 with 111 passing yards and two carries for seven yards, but it was not enough to help the Chiefs to victory.

This article originally appeared on Touchdown Wire: Brutal QB luck continues for Chiefs with Gardner Minshew injury

title: Baker Mayfield brutally honest over Bucs' offensive failure vs. Panthers
description: Baker didn't leave any doubt where his frustrations lie.
fullText:
Baker Mayfield brutally honest over Bucs' offensive failure vs. Panthers originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Tampa Bay Buccaneers' freefall in the second half of the season has continued, with a 23-20 loss to the Carolina Panthers.

The loss now sees the Bucs lose six of their last seven games and gives the Panthers the lead in the NFC South race.

It was once again¬†a game in which the Buccaneers' self-inflicted wounds plagued them, with a miscommunication on the final play between Baker Mayfield and Mike Evans resulting in a game-sealing interception.

And for Baker, speaking post-game, he left it pretty clear what he thought about the offensive performance.

"Got to win out to win the division, get in the playoffs," Mayfield said. "It's as clear as it can be. Wish we would have taken care of business today, but situation doesn't change. It sucks. Too many penalties, kept shooting ourselves in the foot, and got to finish with seven in the red zone instead of three. Same story, different day."

More:Why Buccaneers fans might not like Todd Bowles' message after Panthers loss

Yes, the Buccaneers can still win the division if they win their remaining two games, but currently on a run of form that has seen them lose six of their last seven, are we even sure they can beat the Miami Dolphins on the road next week?

Then the Panthers are at home to close out the season.

But in order to win their final two, the self-inflicted wounds have to stop.

Because losing to a better team is one thing, but losing when you hand them the bat to hit you over the head with, that's tough to deal with.

And right now, the Buccaneers have some soul-searching to do because after starting the year 5-1, they have fallen off a cliff, and making the playoffs now looks like a tough assignment.

title: 45-yard TDs were the Pittsburgh Steelers' specialty in Week 16 vs. Lions
description: They only knew one way to score.
fullText:
45-yard TDs were the Pittsburgh Steelers' specialty in Week 16 vs. Lions originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Pittsburgh Steelers only knew one way to score on Sunday.

If they were 45 yards out, they were going to end up in the end zone. Otherwise, no touchdowns.

This is how that broke down on Sunday against the Lions in Week 16: The Steelers scored three TDs, and all three were from exactly 45 yards out.

Kenneth Gainwell had the first one. It was on a wild catch from Aaron Rodgers in which Gainwell was interfered with, fell, caught the ball on his backside, got up and sprinted away and into the end zone.

Then it was the same guy, twice: Jaylen Warren.

MORE:¬†Taysom Hill makes the kind of NFL history only he can make

He ran for one 45-yard touchdown to go up 22-10.

Then he ran for another one to go up 29-17.

Both epic Warren runs came in the fourth quarter.

It's exactly what the Steelers ordered. They entered the day with a one-game lead in the AFC North on the Baltimore Ravens, but going up against the formidable Lions in Detroit wasn't a given.

Pittsburgh doesn't get a lot of big plays. Their scoring drives are often long and plodding and tight end-heavy.

On this evening, though, the Steelers dialed up the big plays thrice, each from exactly 45 yards out. That was the sweet spot for the Steelers.

title: Panthers rookie Lathan Ransom goes from goat to hero in one week after game-clinching interception
description: Carolina Panthers rookie safety Lathan Ransom has experienced the dramatic highs and lows of playing in the NFL in his first season.  One week after a crucial penalty that led to a costly loss to the New Orleans Saints, Ransom redeemed himself on Sunday by intercepting Baker Mayfield with 42 seconds left to seal the Panthers' 23-20 win over the Buccaneers ‚Äî allowing Carolina to vault into sole possession of first place in the NFC South.  Ransom couldn't have felt much worse last week on the flight home from New Orleans after he was flagged for hitting sliding Saints quarterback Tyler Shough with 9 seconds left on a bang-bang play.
fullText:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) ‚Äî Carolina Panthers rookie safety Lathan Ransom has experienced the dramatic highs and lows of playing in the NFL in his first season.

One week after a crucial penalty that led to a costly loss to the New Orleans Saints, Ransom redeemed himself on Sunday by intercepting Baker Mayfield with 42 seconds left to seal the Panthers' 23-20 win over the Buccaneers ‚Äî allowing Carolina to vault into sole possession of first place in the NFC South.

‚ÄúI faced a lot of adversity, and I heard noise from everybody last week,‚Äù Ransom said. ‚Äú... (But) that‚Äôs how you shake back.‚Äù

Ransom couldn't have felt much worse last week on the flight home from New Orleans after he was flagged for hitting sliding Saints quarterback Tyler Shough with 9 seconds left on a bang-bang play. Officials flagged Ransom for unnecessary roughness, and the 15-yard penalty turned a difficult 61-yard field goal attempt into a far more makable one from 46 yards.

Charlie Smyth put it through the uprights to complete the Saints' 20-17 come-from-behind win.

Had the Panthers defeated the Saints, they would have only needed to beat the Bucs on Sunday to clinch the NFC South and end a seven-year playoff drought. Instead, the loss left the Panthers on the outside of the playoff bubble.

Ransom said he was hard on himself.

But the fourth-draft pick from Ohio State decided early last week that instead of dwelling on the mistake he'd use it as motivation.

‚ÄúI understand that the game is not won or lost by one play, but people behind their phone are going to have their own opinions,‚Äù Ransom said. ‚ÄúI just heard all the noise ‚Äî listened to it and used it as fuel for this game.‚Äù

Ransom leaned on the support last week of veteran defensive leaders such as Jaycee Horn, Derrick Brown and Mike Jackson, who shares the locker next to him.

Jackson and others advised to look ahead, not back and keeping playing at full speed.

‚ÄúHe responded like a grown man should," Jackson said. ‚ÄúAt the end of day, everyone was talking trash to him, like he shouldn't be in the game and this and that. And today he responded like he should be. I'll just say I'm proud of him. Because at the end of the day it's grown man football and he showed that.‚Äù

Panthers coach Dave Canales greeted Ransom on the sideline with a huge hug after interception, and smiled as he spoke about the rookie after the game.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a great story,‚Äù Canales said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs fantastic and it‚Äôs just about belief and having confidence in our guys to be able to be studs about the things we need to work on and be studs about the different decisions that come up. I love that for Lathan ‚Äî for him to be able to make the winning play, the biggest play of the game for us.‚Äù

The Panthers will need more big plays from Ransom and other young players if they hope to dethrone the Buccaneers, who have won the last four NFC South titles.

Carolina can clinch the division with a win next week against Seattle and a Tampa Bay loss to Miami. But if the Bucs win, it will come down to a rematch in Week 18 for the division title.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve learned a bunch throughout the season, especially from that first game,‚Äù Ransom said. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre going to learn. It‚Äôs a learning process. You‚Äôre playing with the best of the best. I learn more and more every game and I try to take those teachings into the next game.‚Äù

AP NFL: https://apnews.com/hub/nfl

title: Jaguars‚Äô 3 standout performers in Week 16 victory vs. Broncos
description: Here are three standout performers from the Jacksonville Jaguars' Week 16 win over the Broncos.
fullText:
The Jacksonville Jaguars took down the Denver Broncos 34-20 to capture their 11th win in the season and get a crucial win over their now 12-3 conference opponent.

After a back-and-forth matchup through the first two and a half quarters, a 10-yard touchdown grab from Travis Etienne Jr. broke open Jacksonville‚Äôs lead to 14, and the Jaguars never looked back.

Three players stood above the rest for their impact in Jacksonville‚Äôs Week 16 win, earning this week‚Äôs game balls: Parker Washington, Trevor Lawrence, and Foyesade Oluokun.

Washington put the Jaguars on the board late in the first quarter with an acrobatic 12-yard touchdown catch to take a 7-0 lead over the Broncos.

Trevor Lawrence to Parker Washington for the TD!

JAXvsDEN on FOX/FOX Onehttps://t.co/HkKw7uXnxV pic.twitter.com/cHFgVwot0m

The 5-foot-10, 204-pound wide receiver entered Week 16 with 39 receptions for 500 yards and three touchdowns, averaging 12.8 yards per catch. He tacked on six more catches, 145 more yards, and a touchdown against Denver, en route to Jacksonville‚Äôs 14-point victory.

Lawrence to Washington. Big first down pickup for @Jaguars

JAXvsDEN on FOX/FOX Onehttps://t.co/HkKw7uXnxV pic.twitter.com/WH5JS4f3fD

Late in the third quarter, Washington picked up a 63-yard catch and run to take Jacksonville into the red zone, and set up a 10-yard receiving touchdown for running back Travis Etienne Jr. to take a 31-17 lead.

PARKER WASHINGTON SE ESCAPA üëã#DUUUVAL pic.twitter.com/4ByTc5ogbU

‚Äî Mundo NFL (@MundoNFL) December 21, 2025

Lawrence backed up his six-touchdown performance against the New York Jets in Week 15 with a four-touchdown outing against Denver, as he willed Jacksonville to a victory.

He finished the game completing 23 of 36 attempts for 279 yards and three touchdowns, and picked up six carries for 20 yards and a score.

He pushed the Jaguars to a 24-17 lead over the Broncos midway through the third quarter, as he ran untouched into the endzone for a one-yard score.

Trevor Lawrence with his 3rd TD of the day!

JAXvsDEN on FOX/FOX Onehttps://t.co/HkKw7uXnxV pic.twitter.com/Oaf25IRPQJ

Lawrence found Washington and tight end Brenton Strange for touchdowns through the air, constantly going back and forth with Denver‚Äôs Bo Nix-led offense.

Some TDs are just Strange

JAXvsDEN on FOX/FOX Onehttps://t.co/HkKw7uXnxV pic.twitter.com/fCCXYvV6Vf

His third passing touchdown of the day, a 10-yard toss to Etienne, set a new season high in touchdown passes thrown in his career.

Trevor Lawrence has 10 total TDs (and counting) in the last two weeks! 

JAXvsDEN on FOX/FOX Onehttps://t.co/HkKw7uXnxV pic.twitter.com/CMR2NLFRPQ

Oluokun made history after recording his sixth tackle against the Broncos in the third quarter of Jacksonville‚Äôs 34-20 victory. He surpassed Telvin Smith Sr. (582) for the fourth-most tackles in the Jaguars' franchise history.

With six tackles in today‚Äôs game, @foyelicious has moved into fourth place in franchise history in tackles (582), passing LB Telvin Smith Sr. pic.twitter.com/Q4VJ8cIGo6

‚Äî JaguarsPR (@JaguarsPR) December 21, 2025

The 6-foot-2, 230-pound linebacker entered Week 16 with 55 tackles, one sack, two forced fumbles, and an interception in 2025, and has been the Jaguars‚Äô leading tackler.His 11 tackles led the Jaguars, recording six more tackles than the next closest Jacksonville defender.

This article originally appeared on Jaguars Wire: Jaguars vs. Broncos: Top 3 performances in Week 16 win

title: NFL playoff picture: What Texans‚Äô win over Raiders means for AFC standings in Week 16
description: The Texans face the Raiders in Houston on Sunday. We break down what the game means for the NFL playoff picture in Week 16.
fullText:
Game result: The Texans beat the Raiders, 23-21, in Week 16. Houston improves to 10-5 on the year and stays at the No. 7 seed in the AFC Playoff picture. Houston remains a game behind the Jacksonville Jaguars in the AFC South, who moved to 11-4 with their win over the Denver Broncos on Week 16.

The Houston Texans are closing in on a playoff berth, but it will be at least another week before they will have a clinching scenario. The Texans host the Las Vegas Raiders in Week 16 and this is a game they absolutely cannot lose.

The Texans are 9-5 and have won six straight in a streak that has included wins over the Jaguars, Bills, Colts, and Chiefs. They beat the Cardinals 40-20 last week. The Texans face a Raiders squad that is 2-12 and has lost eight straight games. Last week, the Raiders were thumped by the Eagles 31-0 in Philly.

Houston is a 14.5-point favorite, which is the biggest spread of Week 16.

The Texans are in second place in the division sitting one game back of the Jaguars. Houston and Jacksonville split their season series and the Texans have a half game lead for the divisional tiebreaker (4-1 vs. 3-1). The Jaguars are traveling to face the Broncos this weekend, so if they lose that but win their two remaining games, the tiebreaker would go to record in common games.

Meanwhile, the Colts sit a game back of the Texans and still has one game left with them. Houston won the first game in Week 13. The Colts need to see the Texans lose in Week 16 or 17 to create a situation in which the Colts can finish ahead of them.

The Texans are in seventh place and hold the final wild card spot ahead of the 8-6 Colts and 7-7 Ravens. If the Texans win and the Colts lose, Houston would have a wild card clinching scenario in Week 17 when they travel to face the Chargers. The Texans enter Week 16 with a 98% chance of making the playoffs at The Athletic‚Äôs playoff simulator. Houston has a 58% chance of claiming a wild card berth and a 40% chance of winning the division.

The Raiders are a common opponent for the Texans and Jaguars. There is a very real chance the Texans and Jaguars finish tied and it common opponents. They are also a common opponent with the Chargers, but Houston and LA will have a head-to-head tiebreaker sorted out when they meet in Week 17.
